loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, where she manages a sari sari store to earn a living. She earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business and has been doing this for five years. She borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC Microfinance to purchase canned goods and soft drinks for sale. She dreams of extending her services by selling more products in her store.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Three years after joining the pig breeder program through a MUK pig loan, Ni Kadek feels greatly helped by the productive capital loan from MUK. Due to the location of her residence in the countryside with her husband and two children, the capital for business development of pigs is needed to support the family's economy.

For the current period, Ni Kadek is planning to buy three piglets for fattening with a price 400,000 IDR per head. She will prepare the feed and she hopes the price of feed will not rise again.

During the five months of fattening, Ni Kadek hopes that no bad things will happen to her three pigs so that the profits from the sales will be more than in the previous period. Ni Kadek, wearing a brown t-shirt, is fourth from the left.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

loans.name: Hisni

texts.en:
Hisni wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the loan, which helped him to improve his family's living standards.  The previous loan was used for changing windows and doors of his house in order to not feel the cold during the winter.

Hisni is very satisfied that he managed to improve the living conditions of his family. He now is requesting a second loan for his business to buy a machine for woodcutting. Until now, he worked as a wood cutter with a low salary and now he is planning to work on his own. The loan will help him to generate more income for his family. He hopes in the future to expand his business.

His goal is to provide a secure life for his family. Hisni wants to thank again Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To buy a woodcutting machine

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
This is Ma. Fe. She previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase quantities of materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in covering their personal, household and business expenditures.

Ma. Fe would like to apply for a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Fe dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials like fabric, thread, etc., needed in her business

loans.name: Wassa  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  WASSA I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  SANZANA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et gombo  avec  MAIMOUNA  au  milieu de la photo position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de réinvestir le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The WASSA I group consists of ten married women who are, on average, 32 years old and also have an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages of the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso region).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farming loan with this institution, and all their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Maimouna (the featured borrower) cultivates groundnut and okra. In the photo, she is in the middle of the sitting row. She plans to use her loan to buy farming inputs to cultivate 0.25 hectare of land (0.6 acre).

After the harvest, Maimouna sells her crop to men and women, in her village.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs per season, an amount which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: La señora Ignacia, es una persona de 40 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su casa propia ubicada en la provincia de Tiraque, tiene ocho dependientes económicos a cargo que son sus hijos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce  Papa 110 cargas, Arveja  3 Cargas.  La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza aproximadamente en una superficie cultivable de 4 Has. que están ubicados en la misma localidad y que son terrenos propios , los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus hijos, vecinos y de trabajadores eventuales, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo comprara un terreno que le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Ignacia, 40, is married and lives in her own home in the province of Tiraque. She studied through primary school and has 8 dependent children in her care. Her business is farming and she produces 110 loads of potatoes and 3 loads of peas. She plants these crops on approximately 4 hectares of land that she owns in the same town where she lives. Her children, neighbors and temporary workers help her with the farming. She lives in a rustic home made of adobe. 

She will use the loan to buy land that will help her to improve her financial situation and also the quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a 44-year-old married woman living in Tukuran, Zamboang del Sur. She has earned income through providing transportation services in her community for three years to support the needs of her five children. She has an income of 3,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from this business.

Without hesitation, Generosa borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair an existing cycle used in her business. She became a member of GDMPC in 2012. She plans in the future to hopefully improve her business to provide her children a better education.

loans.use: To repair an existing cycle for better services.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: Don José, un señor taxista que junto a su esposa buscan como sacar adelante a sus hijos a quienes tiene estudiando en colegios públicos, ajustándose a su capacidad económica, solamente el  continua trabajando en su labor como taxista y su esposa ama de casa, por lo que todos dependen de don José, lo cual es una situación difícil debido al desempleo. Sigue con la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda en esta ocasión hará embaldosado de piso y cambiara el techo antes que lleguen las lluvias por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Don José is a taxi driver. He and his wife look for ways to get ahead for their children, who are studying at public schools. In order to maintain his financial standing, José continues to work as a taxi driver while his wife is a homemaker. All of them are dependent on Don José, which is a difficult situation because of the rate of unemployment.

He continues to be in need of home improvements. On this occasion, he will tile the floor and replace the roof before the arrival of the rainy season. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for tiling the floor and replacing the roof.

loans.name: Wassa  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  WASSA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  SANZANA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  KOROTOUMOU  2 eme  à droite sur la photo position débout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants pour entretenir : 0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de réinvestir le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the WASSA II group are married. On average, they are 32 years old and have 2 children. They all live in traditional families in SANZANA, a village in the 3rd administrative region of Mali (SIKASSO).

They are collaborating with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to be successful with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fourth farming loan with the organization and all of their previous loans were reimbursed. 

They grow peanuts, and KOROTOUMOU is standing second from the right. With her loan, she would like to buy farm inputs to maintain 0.25 hectares of land. After the harvest, their products are sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

She would like to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA per loan. These profits will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Wassa  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  WASSA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  SANZANA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide , le riz et le piment  avec  ABI  au  milieu de la photo position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 220 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt , les frais de santé et aussi une partie de frais de scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The WASSA III group comprises six married women who are, on average, 32 years old and also have an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages of the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso region).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farming loan with this institution, and all their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Abi (the featured borrower) cultivates groundnut, rice and pimento. In the photo, she is in the middle of the sitting row. She plans to use her loan to buy farming inputs and to pay for the cost of plowing on one hectare of land (2.47 acres).

After the harvest, she sells her crop to men and women, in her village.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 220,000 CFA francs per season, an amount which will allow her to repay her loan, to cover healthcare costs and also to pay part of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to cover plowing costs and to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El joven Luis es una persona cristiana, vive en la casa de sus padres, el trabaja en un medio de comunicación cristiano desde hace dos años. Luis y sus padres son de escasos recursos y mayores de edad y hacen lo que pueden para sostenerse como por ejemplo su madre vende en un mercado empanadas y refrescos pero esto solo les alcanza para el día a día con la ayuda de su hijo en la rustica vivienda donde viven tiene problemas con el tejado ya que en este tiempo de lluvias el agua se filtra dentro del inmueble y como solo les alcanza para subsistir, no pueden  reparar el techo por no contar con el dinero al instante, pero a su hijo le alcanzaría para poder pagarlo en cuotas, ese es el motivo por lo que esta familia necesita este tipo de ayuda y así mejorar su calidad de vida y así poder pasar esta temporada de lluvias sin problemas.
texts.en: Luis is a Christian and lives at home with his parents. He has worked in Christian media and communications for two years now. Luis and his parents are poor and his parents are getting older and do what they can to support themselves. His mother sells empanadas and sodas in a market, but this only sustains them day to day with their son's help. They live in a rustic home where they have problems with the roof tiles, and now that it is rainy season the water is coming down inside of the house. Since they barely make enough to survive, they don't have the money on hand to repair the roof, but their son would be able to pay it back in installments. This is why the family needs this type of help, to improve their quality of life and get through the rainy season without problems.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Wassa  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  WASSA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  SANZANA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide , le riz et le  piment  avec  SANATA  1 ere à droite de la photo position débout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 220 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt , les frais de santé et aussi une partie de frais de scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The WASSA IV group comprises six married women who are, on average, 32 years old and also have an average of two children each. They all live in traditional families in Sanzana, one of the villages of the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso region).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farming loan with this institution, and all their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Sanata 1 (the featured borrower) cultivates groundnut, rice and pimento. In the photo, she is standing, first from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy farming inputs and to pay for the cost of plowing on one hectare of land (2.47 acres).

After the harvest, she sells her crop to men and women, in her village.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 220,000 CFA francs per season, an amount which will allow her to repay her loan, to cover healthcare costs and also to pay part of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: María Digna

texts.es:
La Señora María es una señora que tiene gran amistad con las socias del banco comunal Sentimientos, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una belleza tanto natural como colonial, su gente aun mantiene viva la llama de su cultura su gastronomía.

Doña María tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 24, 22 y 14 años, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo se dedica a trabajar y también estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su último hijo cursa los estudios en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es  propia.

La Señora. María al igual que su esposo laboran en la agricultura pero en otra ciudad ya que se dedican a arrendar terrenos para sembrar banano. Cuando no se encuentra en este trabajo está cuidando de su hogar. 

Su primer crédito la va a invertir en la compra de ropa para iniciar este negocio.

Su sueño es tener un camión para vender sus productos en la ciudad.
texts.en:
María is a lady who has great friendships with the members of the Sentimientos communal bank. She lives in the centre of the city of Cuenca. Since December 1999 this city has been a Cultural Heritage Site. It has as much colonial beauty as natural beauty, and its people still keep the flame of their culture and cuisine alive.

María is 44 years old. She lives with her partner and has 3 children aged 24, 22 and 14. Her first son is married and lives independently, her second son works and also studies in a college in the city, and her youngest son is studying in a school in the city. Her husband works in agriculture and they own the  house they live in.

María and her husband work in agriculture but in another city, because they work renting land to plant bananas. When she isn't doing in this job she is taking care of her home.

She will invest her first loan in the purchase of clothing to start a business.

His dream is to have a truck to sell her products in the city.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Felipe Javier

texts.es: El Sr.Felipe es un joven de veinticuatro años de edad, emprendedor, no tiene hijos y no es casado, tiene 2 hermanos mayores y vive actualmente con sus padres, salió profesional a sus casi veintidós años gracias a su capacidad en sus estudios e inmediatamente fue contratado por estas empresas mencionadas para ejercer la actividad de Marketing, ahora el joven poco a poco está haciendo crecer su oficina con la compra de mesas y computadoras para seguir creciendo en la vida y poder ayudar a sus padres el cual él está muy agradecido por haberle brindado tanto apoyo. El Sr. Felipe se enfrenta solo a la vida tratando de ver la manera de crecer y abrirse campo en su rubro que tanto le apasiona demostrado responsabilidad y mucho firmeza en su trabajo que está siendo realizado eficientemente y tiene a sus superiores satisfechos.
texts.en: Felipe is an enterprising young man of 24 who has no children and isn't married. He has two older brothers and lives with his parents. He became a professional before he turned 22 thanks to years of training and studying, and he was immediately hired by companies to do marketing. Now he is growing his office little by little, purchasing desks and computers to continue moving up in life and to help his parents, whom he is very grateful for giving him so much support. Felipe is on his own trying to find a way to grow and open doors in his field, in which he has passionately and firmly demonstrated responsibility and efficiency in his work and has pleased his superiors.

loans.use: to have working capital for his marketing business.

loans.name: Jhon Alan

texts.es: Jhon de 25 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de matemática  que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Jhon tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen profesor de matemática. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jhon   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Jhon is 25 years old. he is single and has no children. He is an agreeable student majoring in mathematics. He studies a lot to reach his goals in life. Jhon's goal is finishing his degree successfully and becoming a good math teacher. With the loan he will pay for his college tuition and buy some school supplies that he needs. Jhon is very grateful for the help and he takes his leave very eager to reach the goals he has set and thanking Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Walegnoumadon Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  WALEGNOUMADON sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge  de 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles nucléaire à  LOBOUGOULA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : pois sucré  avec  FANTA  1ere à droite sur la photo position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, et les frais de labours  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Walegnoumadon group are all married women who are on the average 43 years of age and have three children. They all live in nuclear families in Lobougoula, a village in the third administrative district of Mali (Sikasso). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season.

They are on their sixth agricultural cycle campaign with our institution; all their prior loans have been duly repaid. They cultivate sweet peas, as, for example, Fanta does. She is the first one standing on the right on the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and pay for labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting her produce, she sells it in the village, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average revenue of 250,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. These revenues will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband provide for everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Kayira, composé de femmes mariées et une veuve, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-coura,   Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits, la restauration et des rafraîchissants.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kayira sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AMI, deuxième personne à gauche, compte acheter 2 balles de friperie avec les grossistes de Bamako, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Kayira group consists of some married women and one widow.  These women are, on average, 48 years old and have five children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Fana-Coura, in the town of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

The members of the group know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell clothes, prepare meals and serve drinks.  They are on their fifteenth solidarity loan.

Ami, the featured borrower, is the second person from the left in the photo.  She is planning to buy two bales of used clothing from wholesalers in Bamako.  She will resell her merchandise to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, which will be used to meet the needs of her family.  A part of her profits will also be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Cesar Vallejo Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 personas emprendedoras y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “CESAR VALLEJO”.  La Sra. Gina  de 42 años de edad  y madre de  2 hijos, ella se dedica hace 3 años  a la venta de granos (maíz, Abas, alverja)La Sra. Gina nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus granos  y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en ampliar su pequeña bodega y en la compra de más granos   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Gina y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Gina se encuentra parada en el medio de los dos caballeros se  despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: The "Cesar Vallejo" group consists of eight entrepreneurs who have a lot of creativity for their businesses. Gina is 42 years old and has two children. She has made a living for the past three years selling grains (corn, lima beans, peas). Gina tells us that she has been able to create loyal customers, which has generated profits to cover household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own store where she can sell her grains and have more financial gains. With the loan, she plans to expand her small store and purchase more grains, and in this way she will be able to keep moving forward. Gina and all of the members express their gratitude to Kiva and partner EDAPROSPO for the loan and for the faith the organizations have put in them. Gina is standing between the two men in the photo and leaves with a promise to fulfill all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: Unzi Simon

texts.en:
Unzi Simon is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of them go to school. Unzi Simon runs a medical clinic and has been in business for six years. He has two employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase more drugs and other items. He has no other source of Income.
In five years Unzi Simon would like to expand his business and open other branches.
His major challenges include high taxes and transportation costs.
Unzi Simon says he is happy for the support that Kiva is giving to Finance Sudan to help uplift his small business.

loans.use: for buying more drugs for the clinc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza, age 51, is married with six children. She's from TUkuran Zamboanga del Sur. Flordeliza manages a general store for a living. Her business gives her a total monthly income of 4,000 PHP. She joined GDMPC micro credit this year and is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She hopes to spend a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Romalda

texts.en:
A $1,200 loan is requested by Romalda to improve her business. She is married and her husband is a driver. She lives in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $50. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, water, slippers, books and eggs. Romalda is generating a good income from her business.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in business.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, water, slippers, books and eggs.

loans.name: Amna Group

texts.en: Amna is a 38-year-old married woman and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost three years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market at a profit. Amna is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life. There were days when her children often slept without having any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a member of two person group and plans to use the loan to purchase variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note In the picture Amna is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase new variety of clothes.

loans.name: Kyamabaare Farmer's Goup Group

texts.en: Kyamabaare Farmers was formed to meet the needs of farmers within Kyamabare Village. They had been progressing but lacked farm inputs to enhance their productivity. When the Ugafode staff approached the area six years back, the members were excited because it would answer the cries of  the farmers. They gladly embraced the opportunity and have been acquiring and paying their loans up to today. Vangirista is particularly happy because she has been able to educate some of her children through selling tomatoes and bananas. Vangirista wants to say thank you to Ugafode and the Kiva lenders because she does not know what she would have happened to her large family of 10 children and a jobless husband without the support of loans. She will use the loan to buy organic fertilizers such that she can increase the productivity of tomatoes and therefore her income. The group has hard-working and honest members who are supportive of each other.The first four members, three of them holding forms on the front row from the left are committee members who are resting this cycle but have signed the waiver forms.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Nueva Esperanza” conformada por 09 socios entusiastas que el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado que son personas responsables. Ella es Antonia una de las socias de 45 años de edad casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio y así poder apoyar a su hogar, Antonia toma la decisión de iniciar su negocio donde hace más de 03 años que cuenta con una tienda. Gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado mantener su negocio. Posteriormente piensa implementar su tienda. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda. El grupo  “Nueva Esperanza” está agradecido con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Antonia es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo. Juana está ubicada en la parte superior lado izquierdo, pues no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo, también Gloria del mismo modo.
texts.en: The “Nueva Esperanza” ("New Hope") group consists of nine enthusiastic members who over time have shown to be responsible people. One of the members, Antonia, is 45 years old, married and has two children. With the desire to start her own business and be able to support her household, Antonia made the decision to open a store more than three years ago. Thanks to her efforts she has been able to maintain the business. She plans to use this loan to purchase groceries, snacks and beverages, and in this way she can stock her store. The group is grateful for the people who have made this loan possible and allowing them to keep improving. Antonia is the first person on the left and is wearing a red polo. Another member, Juana, is in the upper left corner because she was not able to arrive on time for work reasons; same for Gloria (who is not pictured).

loans.use: to purchase groceries, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Víctor es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” la cual lo constituye 05 socios y llevan trabajando 04 meses. Víctor de 27 años de edad, casado con 02 hijos menores. Él comenzó trabajando como cobrador de bus,  con el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo invertir para emprender su negocio, donde hace más de 04 años cuenta con un kiosco, ubicada cerca de un colegio, siendo sus mayores clientes los alumnos. Se siente feliz pues cada vez sigue implementando su negocio. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro para poderlo ofrecer como servicio de transporte. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de golosinas y bebidas. El grupo “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” agradece el crédito brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso. Víctor es el primero del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Víctor is a member of the "La Unión Hace La Fuerza" group, which consists of five members who have been working together for four months. Victor is 27 years old, married and has two young children. He started out working as a bus driver and used his income to invest in starting his own business. For more than four years he has had a food kiosk located near a school, since his best customers are student. He feels happy because he continues improving his business. His biggest wish is to purchase a car so he can offer transportation services. He is requesting the loan to purchase snacks and beverages for his kiosk. The "La Unión Hace La Fuerza" group is grateful for the loan, since it makes their progress possible. Victor is the first person on the left side.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Avdush

texts.en:
Avdush is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the loan, which helped him to purchase a woodcutting machine. The loan has had a good impact on his family's living standards. The previous loan helped him to provide woodcutting services to those in his community in order to provide heat during the cold weather.

He is very satisfied and had a lot of work during the wintertime. In this way, he generated more income and managed to improve the living conditions for his family life.

Avdush now is requesting a second loan for the same business to repair his woodcutting machine. He is planning in the future to continue working in the same business. The loan will help him to generate more income for his family. He hopes in the future to expand his business.

His goal is to provide a better education for his children. Avdush appreciates all Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To repair his woodcutting machine.

loans.name: Akacucu Group

texts.en:
Akacucu group was formed way back in 2010 by men and women who had similar problems. These included being widows, widowers, petty traders, low income earners and many others. They joined their efforts together and formed a group to win more recognition from whoever could support them in their needs. Mary is a widow and a member of the group who claims to have lost hope in life when she lost her husband to AIDS, she was later approached by one of her confidants who referred her to the group where she was given counseling by group members in business management and farming. The group members afterwards contributed for her a seed capital of UGX 50,000 which is used diligently and has increased to UGX 300,000.  Mary currently runs a grocery business which she supplements with farming. This has enabled her to live positively and  to meet her day to day needs including regular hospital visits. Mary’s main challenge now is diversion of her working capital into medical expenses, she has now applied for a loan of sh.250,000 from UGAFODE to boost her grocery during this school holiday where the demand is high. 

There are 12 clients in the picture. Two of them will get loans during the next cycle.

loans.use: To buy items for her grocery

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Don José tiene 49 años, es casado, tiene un hijo al que ayuda en su educación, hace 15 años que vive en el trópico, pero 10 que de dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivado 2 has. de palmito para exportación y 2 has. de yuca para venta local, don Jose cultiva en una parte de terreno de su hijo mayor, ahora tiene la oportunidad de poder comprarse un terreno y de esta manera podra ampliar sus cultivos, contaba con un monto de dinero que le dio por adelantado al dueño del terreno y le falta el monto que esta solicitante para reintegrar, es por eso que solicita para poder completar su deuda y así obtener el título del terreno, indica que este nuevo terreno le ayudara a incrementar  sus ingresos y así poder darle una mejor educación a su hijo que le toca el próximo año la universidad y tiene que salir a la ciudad.
texts.en:
José, 49, is married and has a son who he helps with his studies.  For 15 years he has lived in the tropics but for ten of those he has been involved in agriculture.  He is cultivating two acres of fan palms for export and two acres of yucca plant for local sale.  José cultivates part of his older son's land and now has the opportunity to buy land so he can expand his crop production.  

He had saved enough money for the downpayment of the land but now he needs the rest to pay off the debt and receive the title to the land.  He says this new land will help him increase his income so he can give his son, who is about to enter the university in a different city next year, a better education.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Gotitas De Amor” conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras y comprometidas, que cada día luchan por salir adelante con el único propósito de velar por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de Eugenia una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de pollo, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente, lleva más de 11 años en dicha actividad. Comenzó como ayudante en la venta de pollo con los deseos de mejorar y los conocimientos adquirió inició su propio negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo a podido construir parte de su vivienda. Su mayor deseo es de tener una avícola, pues así tendrá mayores ganancias. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollos y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Eugenia de 37 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos (02) de ellos  aún dependientes.  El grupo “Gotitas De Amor” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Eugenia  se encuentra sentada y viste casaca y polo color negro.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "Gotitas de Amor", is comprised of eight committed women entrepreneurs who struggle daily toward their only goal of watching out for their families' well being.

Eugenia, one of the members of the group, works as a street vendor and has been selling chicken for 11 years.  She started the business in an effort to improve her situation and gain more knowledge.  Thanks to her hard work she has been able to build part of her house.  Her wish is to have a poulty farm one day so she could earn more money.  She has requested a loan to buy chicken to sell to her customers.

Eugenia is 37 years old, married and has three children, two of whom still live at home.  The "Gotitas de Amor" group is grateful to the people making this loan possible.  Eugenia is the one seated, wearing a black top and jacket.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
Mariela es socia de la alcancía El arbolito

Mariela tiene 64 años es casada con 02 hijos. Mariela trabaja para apoyar a su esposo y darle a sus hijos buenos estudios. Ella tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos como abarrotes y verduras. En su negocio trabaja todos los días de la semana, sus clientas son sus vecinas que la conocen muy bien ya que vive en su localidad ceca de 30 años, con el dinero del préstamo solicitado podrá comprar más productos para su bodega, en el futuro desea ampliar y mejorar su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos. Mariella está muy agradecida por este préstamo, en la foto es la tercera de la izquierda tiene pantalón color morado
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the communal bank "El Arbolito".  She is 64, married and has two children.  She works to help her husband and to give her children a good education.  Out of her home, and every day of the week, she runs a store where she sells all kinds of groceries and vegetables.  Her customers are neighbors who know her very well since she has lived in the town for nearly 30 years.

Mariela plans to use the loan to buy more products for her store.  In the future she would like to expand and improve the business to increase her income.  She is very grateful for the loan.  Mariela is the one in purple pants standing third from the left.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Buena Vista De Oquendo Group

texts.es:
Eleuteria es una integrante de la alcancía  "Buena Vista de Oquendo"

Eleuteria es soltera y madre de 02 jóvenes, vive en casa de su padre quien le ha facilitado un lugar para que inicie su propio negocio .Eleuteria tiene una bodega  donde vende toda clase de productos comestibles como abarrotes, frutas y verduras. Su negocio esta abierto al público todos los días desde muy temprano hasta muy tarde, su negocio le brinda la oportunidad de darles a su padre y sus hijos apoyo en la alimentación y los estudios.Eleuteria quiere seguir trabajando para convertir su bodega en una de las mejores, el crédito que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar más productos y así tener su negocio bien surtido.
Eleuteria está feliz por saber que personas de todo el mundo la van apoyar en su negocio, en la foto esta sentada viste polo color rojo.
texts.en:
Eleuteria is a member of the communal bank "Buena Vista de Oquendo".  She is single and the mother of two children and lives in the house her father gave her so she could start her own business.  She runs a store and sells all kinds of groceries, fruit and vegetables.  Her store is open to the public every day from very early in the morning until late in the day.  Through her business she is able to help her father and support her children in their education and putting food on the table.

Eleuteria wants to turn her store into one of the best and the loan she is requesting is to buy more products so she can have a good inventory.  She is happy knowing that people from all over the world will support her business.  She is the one seated wearing a red top.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three calves.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 45-year-old single mother with seven children, four of whom go to school. She lives in Nakatoogo village with her children. She is a trader who deals in clothes for ladies. She has been in the textile business since 1996. She works seven days a week and each day she works 14 hours. She sells her products to residents from Nakatoogo, Kiwangala, Bethelem and Kampungu. 

Florence started this business in order to get money to pay school fees for her children and because she already had some experience in textiles. She has acquired this loan to buy more clothing. She hopes that in the near future she can enlarge her business and build rental houses in Nakatoogo.

However, she has two big problems that can hinder her business. The first one is price fluctuation (sometimes she purchases clothes at high prices and by the time she sells them she usually finds that the prices have declined, which reduces her profits). She also lacks sufficient capital to restock trendy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the shop.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 39-year-old Ugandan and married to Fred. They have six children, four of whom go to school. She also has a dependent who is elderly.

She runs a boutique in Muhorro town and works 13 hours a day, six days a week. She has been operating this business since 2008, and it has been the key source of come for the family, which is the reason why she started the business. Her additional source of income is from the sale of agricultural produce, mainly beans and maize.

Rehema would like to access a loan of 1,500,000 to increase her stock in the boutique, especially in gumboots, sweaters, and jackets to mention but a few.

She is hard working and honest. She appreciates the loan services that are made easier for people to access.

loans.use: to buy more items like gum boots, sweaters and jackets.

loans.name: Sunday James

texts.en:
Sunday James is a 33-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 13. All of them go to school.

Sunday runs a general store, and has been in this business for seven years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3000 SSP to purchase flour and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Sunday would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include paying the high prices at the market.

Sunday says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as flour, etc.

loans.name: Jan

texts.en:
Jan is a 39-year-old responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and children. Her husband is a government employee and three of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children, and they are facing many hurdles in life. 

Jan has been helping her husband by operating a clothing sales business in her house for the past three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to buy a variety of clothes at a cheaper rate and then sell them for a profit. 

In the future, Jan looks forward to opening a small boutique in the market. She plans to save some of the money from the profits she earns to pay the educational expenses of her children. 

Jan is very bright with great vision, and this loan could help her fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old and married with one child. She and her family live in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, she provides transportation services. She has been doing this business for nine years, earning a small income that is not enough to pay for the basic needs of the family. 

Lydia joined GDMPC and has borrowed 3,000 PHP in order to repair a tricycle. This will help her offer better transportation services to the community. In the future, she hopes to have the money to purchase another tricycle so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To pay to repair a tricycle.

loans.name: Adona

texts.en:
Adona of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is a carpenter and they also have a transportation services business, earning 10,000 a month. As a new member of GDMPC, she is borrowing 15,000 to repair the existing tricycle and for a down payment for another unit. 

Adona plans to have an additional tricycle to gain more income for the better future of her children.

loans.use: to repair the existing tricycle.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is a 28-year-old energetic and hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and children. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession, and his monthly income is not enough to pay for the household expenses. 

Rizwana wants to educate her children in good schools so they will have a bright future. Currently she can’t afford to send them to good schools due to  financial constraints. Because of this, she is very worried about their future. 

Rizwana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to open a beauty salon in her home. She is a very skilled woman and she wants to  generate an alternate source of income for her family. She will purchase cosmetic products such as lipsticks, creams, facials scrubs, makeup kits, etc. as well as some chairs for her salon. 

She is very hopeful that she will receive this loan so she will be able to start her business. She will spend the profits she earns on paying for her children's education expenses as well as paying back her installments.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products such as lipsticks, creams, facials scrubs, makeup kits, etc. as well as some chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 39 years old. She runs a grocery kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy books, coffee, sugar, salt, soft drinks, slippers and fish to offer in her store.

She makes good money from her sales, and she plans to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Manuela lives in a town near a school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy grocery items. Manuela is happy with the TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) program, which offers loans to help poor people start and maintain businesses.

loans.use: To buy books, coffee, sugar, salt, soft drinks, slippers and fish.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nieta, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 30 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-coura, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce des produits cosmétiques, des condiments et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
La cliente MAMOU  première personne dans le rang des debout à partir de la gauche, compte acheter une balle de friperie avec les grossistes de Bamako, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité
texts.en:
The Nieta group is made up of married women, who average 30 years of age with six children each and who all live in traditional extended families in the Fana-coura district of Fana in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).They got to know each other as relatives, neigbors and friends. Their activities include restauration and the sale of cosmetic products, condiments and soaps. The women in the Nieta group are on their third group loan.

The customer Mamou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is planning to buy a bale of second-hand clothing from wholesalers in Bamako and she will resell the clothes on a retail basis to a customer base made up of women and men. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be used partly to provide for her family's needs with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 61-year-old married woman with two children who is earning a living by supplying motor transport services in Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She has been in this business for 20 years and is earning PHP 3,000 monthly from this business. She has gained access to micro finance since she joined GDMPC micro credit. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase tires and other accessories for her motorbike. She dreams of having a motorcycle with a side car in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for her motorbike.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is 45 years old and lives in the rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has five children, three of whom are still attending school. For the last seven years, Mao has been working as a rice farmer in the local area to support her family. The current business earns her about 12,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.
Mao has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she completely repaid the loans while the other member has had five cycles. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Tasrin

texts.en:
Tasrin is a 39-year-old man and is married to Narni, a 37-year-old lady.
From the marriage, they are blessed with 3 children: Razak who is 15 years old and in the 2nd grade of Junior High School, Rahayu who is 14 years old and in the 1st grade of Junior High School, and Farhan who is 6 years old.
Tasrin is a fisherman. He catches the fish every day and sells them to the fish seller. He is expecting to generate more income from this business.
Therefore, Tasrin has requested a loan for IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on a new trawl and cooler box. Tasrin is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new trawl and cooler box

loans.name: Khaidav

texts.en: Mr. Khaidav, 57 years old, lives with her wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger on a plot of land. In 2004, he established his own monastery and began rendering religious services to local people. As time passes, the number of people who listen to his teachings increases. His son has a mental disorder and needs constant care from his mother. The ger they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. Because their ger is made of woods rather than felts, repairing and insulation is possible. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, felts, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can make wall insulation and roof repairs to his Mongolian traditional ger. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to repair his ger.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is 39 years old, married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through selling various kinds of vegetables and sometime she works for others for a fee. Pov can earn about KHR 33,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 18,000 each day for the future.
This is the fifth loan for Pov with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pov, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more vegetables to resale. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resale.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thorn is 50 years old and married with six children. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income. They can earn about 16,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 11,000 KHR each day for the future needs.
Thorn has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already. Thorn completely paid back the past loans which have enabled her to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on cultivating her rice. Now she hopes to increase her crop yield by purchasing more fertilizer and rice seeds with this new loan, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka is a 37-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 5 children who are between the ages of 5 and 15. All of them go to school.
Nyoka runs a clothes store, and has been in business for 4 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4000 SSP to purchase clothes. This business is her only source of income.
In 5 years Nyoka would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices at the market. Nyoka says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 28 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer on a five-hectare farm for several years. To earn additional income, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day and allows her to save 14,000 KHR each day after expenses.
Phalla has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Phalla repaid the past loans. Now she and her group members are asking for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR respectively. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow healthier rice to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ruben Antonio

texts.es: Don Rubén de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 9 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee una buena clientela pues su medicamento son de muy buena calidad el desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar mas medicinas por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Rubén, 38, lives in his own house with his wife and his 9-year-old son, who is studying. He has been selling natural medicine for several years. His business is located in a market close to his home. He has a good clientele because his medicine is of very good quality. 

He would like to expand his business, so he has applied for a loan to buy more wholesale medicine. He will then be able to earn a better income to give his family everything they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy wholesale natural medicine.

loans.name: Sert

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Sert is 56 years old and widowed. She has six children, two of whom are still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and growing cabbage. Having been in this business for 18 years, she can earn about $14 per day and manages to save about $9 each day after the expenses.
Sert has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve some financial burden. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to plow her cultivated land. She hopes to grow healthier rice and cabbage so as to increase her family’s income, better her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plow her cultivated land.

loans.name: Maria  Estela

texts.es: Doña Maria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 11 y 18 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, es una señora trabajadora y responsable con sus deberes, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 8 años, vende de toda clase de productos de primera necesidad como: azúcar,frijoles, golosinas, etc. doña maria esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como: granos básicos, canela, aceite, sal, macarrones, huevos, etc. para así no perder los clientes por falta de mercadería y que sus ventas sean mas grandes y así mismo tener un mejor nivel económico.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, lives in her own house with her two children, ages 11 and 18. They are currently studying. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible with her duties. She has had a small store for 8 years where she sells all types of essential products, such as sugar, beans, snacks, etc.

Maria is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for her business, such as basic grains, cinnamon, oil, salt, macaroni, eggs, etc., so that she does not lose her clients due to a lack of merchandise. Her sales will be greater and she will have a better economic status.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Jesus habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Doña jesus es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un credito para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios telas, hilos, elástico, botones, zippers, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados y asi mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en: Jesus lives in a home she owns with her husband and son. She makes clothing. The business is located in her home. Jesus is an incredible and exemplary woman, since she is very hardworking, responsible and positive. In addition, people give good references about and her work. She makes a variety of clothing at accessible prices. She also offers quality work and that is why a lot of people prefer her. She has been doing this activity for 18 years  so she has a lot of experience and above all regular customers who prefer her more and more every day. She has made the decision to ask for a loan to invest in her small business by buying  para  necessary materials such fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc. to make a variety of clothing. Everything she is doing is to improve a better service to the customers so that they will be motivated to keep asking for her services and then her sales and income will increase and thus her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, needles, buttons, etc

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 40-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and one son. Her husband has been driving a taxi from eight years and this is the only source of income for her family.
Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required to the engine of the taxi because it’s almost impossible for him to earn income from it in the condition it is in. Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to cover the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit amount her husband would like to buy one more taxi in future.
Yasmeen desires to provide a quality education to her child and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Cristo Nuestro Amigo Group

texts.es:
“Cristo Nuestro Amigo” Es una alcancía conformada por 06 socios todos son vecinos del mismo lugar, una de las socias más entusiastas es Verónica de 51 años. Ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, hace 06 años se dedica a la venta de comidas, el negocio está ubicado en su casa donde prepara sus comidas y  reparte a sus clientes que en su mayoría son trabajadores de diferentes instituciones, diariamente vende  aproximadamente 40 menús, su trabajo es muy sacrificado pero esta agradecida por que le permite sostener a su hijo y darle una buena educacion. Verónica ha solicitado este préstamo para la compra de insumos que utiliza en su negocio como menestras, aceite y tubérculos. En el futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurante para poder atender a mucha gente.
Verónica  esta agradecida a los inversores de todo el mundo por su préstamo y el de su grupo comunal, en la foto viste polo a rayas rojo y blanco.
texts.en:
"Cristo Nuestro Amigo" is a communal bank made up of six members, all of whom are neighbors from the same place. 

One of the most enthusiastic members is Verónica, 51. She is single and has one son. She has been selling food for six years. Her business is located in her home, where she prepares meals and distributes them to her clients, who are mainly workers from various institutions. She sells about forty meals per day. Her work is very demanding, but she is grateful because she is able to provide for her son and give him a good education.

Verónica has applied for this loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as legumes, oil, and root vegetables. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant so that she can serve many people.

Verónica is grateful to the lenders from all over the world for her loan and that of her group. In the photo, she is wearing a red-and-white striped jersey.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Candida  Luisa

texts.es: candida de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, tambien vive con sus 3 hijos pero ellos tabajan y le ayudan en los gastos de la casa, es una mujer luchadora y responsable. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, candida desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú para tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Candida, 55, lives in her own house with her husband and her three children, who work and help her with the household expenses. She is a responsible woman and a fighter. She has been selling food close to her home for several years. She has a large fixed clientele because she offers good prices for her meals. 

Candida would like to expand her stall by buying tables, chairs, and more ingredients to give variety to her menu so that she can have a better income. However, she does not have the necessary earnings to make this investment, so she has applied for a loan to buy these items. She will then earn a better income to give her family everything they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, beans, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Dignora Delmy

texts.es: Dignora vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 4 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. dignora quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, carteras, bolsos y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Dignora lives with her life's companion and two children in a home she owns. She has sold clothes for 4 years with the business and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to earn better income. The business is located in her residence and she has gained a lot of clientele because people know that it is all quality at accessible prices. Dignora wants to make to make a new investment because she doesn't have enough capital to back her up. That is why she is making an investment that will allow her to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, purses, wallets and every her business needs. She is sure she can pay off the debt ands he hopes to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Franklin Otoniel

texts.es: Don franklin vive en casa alquilada con su madre y su esposa, el tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia,  vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, las personas lo prefieren  porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y siempre a la orden de los clientes; franklin es un hombre dedicado a su labor, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, variedad bebidas, etc.  Don Franklin  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Franklin lives in a rental house together with his mother and wife.  He has run a small store in his home for a number of years.  He sells basic household products: beans, eggs, bread, etc. and has gained a lot of customers as he keeps his store well stocked.  People prefer to buy from him because he always has what they need and sells good-quality products at affordable prices.  He is always at his customers' service.  Franklin is a man who is committed to his work.  In common with all good shopkeepers, he would like to increase his business and invest in it but he needs capital in order to do so.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, a variety of drinks, etc.  Franklin has a good repayment record and is certain that he will pay back this loan.  He is also confident that he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 26-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and two children. Both of her children are studying in schools. Her husband has been successfully operating a tailoring center for three years.

Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. The main reason for the loan is that her husband wants to expand his business. There are currently two workers in her husband’s tailoring center, working for him. He wants to hire two more workers so that his production capacity could be increased. For that purpose he requires two more new sewing machines and this loan would be used to purchase new sewing machines.

Saima is very hopeful that after getting this loan her husband’s business will flourish. As she is living in a rented house, she desires to have her own house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 38-yr-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 15.  All of them go to school.

Joan runs a general store and has been in business for 6 years. There is no other source of income in addition to this business. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase sugar, water, soda, and many other items. In 5 years Joan would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Joan says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, soap, water, soda, etc.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Rem is a 34-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava in the local area, and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 18 years, Rem and her husband can make a daily income from her current business of about 30,000 KHR and are able to save for future needs about 12,000 KHR per day after expenses.

This is the first loan for Rem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava planting and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely grow her cassava so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing the field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Don jose de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos y su esposa, el posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maiz para elaborarlas ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, Don jose solicita un credito para poder comparar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y asi seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
José, 43, lives in his own house with his five children and his wife.

He has had a mill for several years.  He has a lot of customers, mainly women who make tortillas.  They go to him to grind corn to make tortillas because he's a friendly and responsible person.

José's requesting a loan to be able to buy blades, discs, and all the tools he needs to have a good mill so he can continue with his business and provide for his family's daily needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, etc. for his mill

loans.name: San Pablo De Chauca Group

texts.es: La nueva Alcancía Comunal  “San Pablo De Chauca” está conformada por 07 socios emprendedores y entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar.  Fady es la que preside el grupo, pues  fue elegida por sus compañeros. Ella tiene 34 años de edad separada con 01 hijos dependiente, la cual ha sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Fady se dedica a la siembra y venta de chirimoya, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos y turistas que visitan el lugar. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo a podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.  Su mayor deseo es de poner un restaurante, ya que de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de abono. El nuevo grupo “San Pablo De Chauca” agradece el crédito brindado. Fady  es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa color negro.
texts.en: The newly-established “San Pablo De Chauca” community bank has seven entrepreneurial members who are eager to start work.  Fady is the group's president, having been elected to this role by her fellow group members.  She is 34 years old, separated, and has one dependent child who is her biggest  motivation to keep going.  Fady's business is sowing and selling 'chirimoya'  (custard apples).  Her main customers are neighbors and tourists who visit her town.  She feels happy because, thanks to her hard work and effort, she has been able to provide her child with a better quality of life.  Her biggest wish is to set up a restaurant as this would make her better profits.  She requested this loan to buy compost.  The newly-established "San Pablo De Chauca" group are grateful for the loan they are receiving.  Fady is the lady on the far right of the photo, wearing a dark sweater.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Sadbaroi

texts.ru: Садбарой мотивированная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами  13 лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажей ткани. Она реализует свой товар в магазине, который находится в центре села.
