Она старается обновлять товар каждый сезон и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Она должна обновлять товар для нового летнего сезона, однако она не имеет денег для покупки товара. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sadbaroi is a motivated and purposeful woman. She is married and has four children. To provide for her family with all of the necessities, she opened her own business 13 years ago selling fabric. She sells her merchandise in a shop located in the center of the village. She tries to refresh her products each season and thereby attract more customers. She needs to refresh her merchandise for the coming summer season, but cannot afford to buy new merchandise. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to buy merchandise for the summer season. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy fabric for new season

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir is a 60-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 1999, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. Due to the large family size and low monthly income they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods like rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items for his general store. This will satisfy his clients more professionally as well as increase his savings for a better future for his children. The profit amount would be used to expand the business and pay the household expenses.

Munir and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her general store.

loans.name: Aleksandar

texts.en:
Aleksandar is 32 years old and married. He is the father of two children, 7 and 4 years old.  They live in a minority community. Aleksandar is a hard worker who puts in a lot of effort to support his family. To earn a living, Aleksandar has operated his own business for more than 8 years as the Printing House for advertising materials for individuals and companies.
 
According to Aleksandar, this type of business is very beneficial. He has a lot of demands and he is able to earn enough for his family's needs. Now he is in need of a loan to change his working equipment by adding a new printing machine for advertising.

The loan will help him to generate more income. He hopes in the future to expand his business more. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a new printing machine.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia  desde hace 18 años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida,  Maria desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María, 42, lives in her own house with her son.  She's a responsible woman who strives for her family to have everything they need to survive.

Currently she has worked selling food near her home for 18 years.  She has a lot of steady customers because she charges a good price for a plate of food.

María wants to expand her locale and buy tables, chairs, and more ingredients to vary her menu and have a little more income.  She doesn't have sufficient income for this investment, though, so she's requesting a loan to buy those things.  This way she'll earn more profit so she can give her son what he needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat, 28, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on four-hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for ten years, while her husband is a fisherman. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future.

Rat has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. She fully repaid the past loan, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to grow a healthy crop of rice and earn more to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Elsa Iraheta

texts.es: Doña elsa de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como: huevos, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, etc.  Asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa, 58, lives in her own house with her three children.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities, beans, milk, bread, and other products.  She has many years of experience in her business, which has given her the experience in sales that allows her to earn the best profits.

Her store's located in her home.  She's very well known among the neighbors in the area.  She has acquired a lot of customers because her store is stocked.

She wants to grow her business and make a new investment.  She needs capital, though, so she's requesting a loan to buy what she needs for her store: eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, sweets, refreshments, etc.

She's certain she'll pay off the debt and also trusts she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, oils, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: John Lwanga

texts.en:
John, age 68, is married with three children. He is a third time borrower with Ugafode and is impressed by the services offered to him. With the previous loans, John was in a position to increase the size of his pig sty and also buy pigs which have grown and have started fetching him some money through sales of pigs. This has enabled him to get money to pay tuition for his son at the university as well as more for his other dependents. 

He hopes to grow the number of his pigs up to 2,000, which will in turn increase his income base, since there is a high demand for the pigs. He is a hardworking old man. In the photo is John with the Ugafode staff member (right to left) in front of the pig sty.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 29, is married and living with her family in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Chantha earns a living through growing rice, and she has been in this agribusiness for five years, earning about 22,000 KHR per day. Ater expenses, she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Chantha has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely repaid the past loan, which helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chantha wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor in plowing the field. She hopes to grow her rice on time so as to earn a larger income to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина человек, который вносит для образования молодежи Таджикистана большой вклад. Она грамотная и умная учительница в средней школе, которой 52 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 8 детей. 4 детей совершеннолетние и 4 еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж добрый человек, но он имеет маленький доход. Нигина вместе семьей живет бедно. Их дом имеет плохое состояние. Дом нуждается в капитальном ремонте, так как двери и окна старые, пол тоже имеет дырки, откуда вылезают насекомые. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомон для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigina is a person who has made a great contribution to the education of the young people of Tajikistan. She is a competent and wise high school teacher who is 52, married, and has right children. Four of her children are adults, and four are still teenagers. Her husband is a good person, but earns little income. Nigina and her family are poor. Their house is in bad condition and needs major repairs. The doors and windows are old, the floor has gaping holes that allow insects in. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somon to buy building materials to repair her house. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka is a 35-yr-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 12.  All of them go to school.

Nyoka runs a clothing store, and has been in business for 3 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase clothes and many other items to sell. She has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In 5 years she would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Nyoka says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 51-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters and three sons. Her husband has been driving a taxi for 22 years and this is the only source of income for the family. 

Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi because it’s almost impossible for him to get some earnings from it. Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit amount her husband would buy one more taxi in the future. 

She desires to provide quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business.

loans.use: To meet the cost of repairing the taxi.

loans.name: Durdona

texts.ru: Дурдона молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 дочерей. Ее муж имеет свой бизнес. Дурдона очень умелая портниха и более 13 лет она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она толерантная, и поэтому с терпением создает шедевры мастерства шитья и кройки. Она шьёт все виды женской одежды и ее клиенты довольны ею. Она справляется с бизнесом сама. Дурдона сделала немного накоплений для ремонта дома, но у нее мало денег и не хватает для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Durdona is a young, purposeful woman. She is 28, married, and has two children. Her husband has his own business. Durdona is a very skillful dressmaker, and has been involved in making women's clothing for more than 13 years. She is tolerant, and is patiently creating skillful sewing and cutout masterpieces. She sews all kinds of women's clothing and her customers are pleased with her work. She operates the business by herself. Durdona has saved a little money to repair her house, but she doesn't have much money and it's not enough to buy building materials. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy building materials. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her old house

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: marta vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras: plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; marta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Marta lives in her own home with her three children.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables: bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, potatoes, etc.  She has been running her business for some years and has gained a lot of experience in making sales.  The place where she sells her products is a very strategic and busy one.  Marta has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from her as her produce is fresh, well priced and good quality, and she provides excellent customer service.

Marta is an entrepreneurial woman who is committed to her work and has a great desire to make progress.  She is always looking for ways to achieve success.  Over the last few weeks, her demand has increased and she would like to make the most of this situation by making a new investment in her business.  However, she does not have enough capital.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.  This will enable her to make better profits and provide her children with what they need, without limitations.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, oranges, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Maa Ugratara Group

texts.en:
Lacha, aged 37, is a permanent resident of Basuguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Basuguda village is a tribal village which is 7 Kms from Rayagada town. All the households of this village are marginal farmers with less than one acre of land and are daily wage earners. On these small pieces of land they cultivate cotton and pulses (lentils). 

The lady standing on the extreme right with raised hand in the photograph is Lacha. She lives with her husband and her mother in-law. The main source of income for Lacha is selling milk and daily wage earning. She works in the nearest papermill as a daily wage earner. She purchased two cows from the first loan she took out from Mahashakti Foundation. 

When Mahashakti Foundation started housing loans, Lachha, along with three other women of her village formed a Joint Liability group named Maa Ugratara to access this loan. It was a blessing for them because they are living in small houses. Lacha wants to repair her house and add on another room from the present loan. The other three members of her group are Ganga, Sujata and Rasmita. The group members are very happy with this support.

loans.use: To pay for cement, bricks etc.

loans.name: Sindjiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sindjiya, sont mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-coura, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’aliments, de savon, des habits et de jus.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sindjiya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MAMOU, au milieu dans le rang des débout, compte acheter deux kilogramme de viande, une dizaine de miche de pain, un demi-litre d’huile pour la préparation du Sandwich  qu’elle vend à proximité du lycée FOUTA essentiellement  aux élèves  et à diverse autres personnes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of Sindjiya Group are married woman who average 34 years of age and 4 children. They live in extended traditional families in the Fana-Coura neighborhood in Fana, Koulikouro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They sell food products, soaps, clothing and juices, and are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mamou is the woman in the center of the standing row. She intends to buy two kilograms of meat, about ten loafs of bread, and half a liter of oil, to make sandwiches that she sells near Fouta High School, mostly to students and to other people.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40) to be used in part to provide for her family, and in part to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread and oil to make sandwiches

loans.name: Maa Bangarama Group

texts.en:
Maa Bangarama JLG was formed in the year 2013 by four active but poor tribal women of Basuguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India in order to access a house repair loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Majhimani, the group leader who is standing on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph took the leadership and the initiative to contact Mahashakti Foundation for the same.

 Majhimani is 45 years old and lives with her husband, three sons of 25, 20 and 15 years and one daughter of 13 years. Along with household work, Majhimani is running a business of milk selling. She purchased a cow from her previous loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Her husband and two sons work in a papermill as daily wage earners. Her younger son does the cultivation work and her daughter helps her with household work. Her family has a monthly income of 6000 INR which is hand to mouth for her. 

In this situation Majhimani has not been able to construct a suitable house for her family. So from the present house repair loan, Majhimani wants to purchase cement, bricks and other house-building materials for renovate her existing house and extend out another room for her family. Majhimani dreams to help her children get married in a respectable manner. The other three members of the group are Indrama, Cinnami and Mini, who are also planning to repair their houses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bricks, cement, etc.

loans.name: Nasantogtokh

texts.en: Mr. Nasantogtokh, 47 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been taking photographs for twenty-six years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this business. During the holidays, his income from photography reaches its maximum. His youngest son is currently studying at university. His two older sons both work in construction. He is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy an automobile that runs on natural gas. A natural gas vehicle emits fewer pollutants and wastes less fuel, as compared with automobile engines powered in other ways. The borrower will use this car for taxi services, and to reach the central children's park or any popular place quickly. It will give him some mobility and efficiency. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy an automobile that runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en: Ram is the 61-year-old widowed mother of two children, who earns a living farming rice on one hectare of farmland. She has been in this agribusiness for 30 years, and the business currently earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to feed the family. Ram’s Group consists of two members who live in the same village, and this is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her loans from VisionFund to improve her support of her family’s living and business expenses. Now Ram is leading her group to apply for a loan, and she will use her share to spend on labor to in plow the field. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña teresa de 67 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña teresa  solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 67 years old. She lives with her family in her own home. She has made a living selling tortillas and pupusas from her home for many years. She works from Monday to Sunday. She has many customers because she is a very hardworking and kind person. With the profits that she receives, she is able to settle her home expenses. 

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy corn in 100 kg batches to continue producing tortillas and therefore receive a better profit in order to have more economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 43-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband buys scrap to be used in manufacturing plastic products and sells it in the main market at a profit. Razia is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband’s use. He will use the loan to buy scrap products to be used in making plastic products. So that he can respond quickly to customer needs, he plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Razia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy scrap for resale, to be used in manufacturing plastic.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Seang is 31 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. Seang is a rice farmer, while her husband is a fisherman. Having been in business for 10 years, they are able to earn 20,000 KHR a day, and they manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day. This is the fourth loan for Seang from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her to improve her business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice plantation and also to grow her crops in a healthy manner, to make more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Kasi

texts.en:
Kasi is a married client from Iraq. He is 39 years old and has four children. Kasi is the sole provider for the family.

Kasi owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. Kasi established his business in 2008, and has gained much experience in this field. He now has hired an employee and is becoming well-known and respected in his neighborhood.

Kasi is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD which he will use to renovate his shop. Kasi believes that this loan will improve his business and increase his profits and will attract more customers and will give him the ability to take better care of his family and provide the needs of his children.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 48 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of vegetables in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife Balqees has requested a loan of 32,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Balqees is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run, aged 47, is married and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water, located in the Prey Chor district of Kopong Cham. 

For the past 30 years, she has operated a farming business, mainly harvesting rice to supply food for the family and for sale. She normally generates a net income of $4 per day. Her monthly expenses are food and allowances for her children. She dreams of expanding her rice farm and adding more crops according to the seasonality of crops.

With the USD 1,000 loan, she wants to buy a motorcycle for household use. She has some savings, and she will add the loan to that and purchase a motorcycle. She decided to be with HKL in order to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Shameem Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a 53-year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. She is a mother of five children and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. 

Shameem and her husband have been saving money from many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose, as a member of a two-person lending group, Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van and can start their own business. In this way their monthly income would be increased. This could solve many of their financial problems. Shameem is very much thankful to Kiva  

Note: In the picture Shameem is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase van.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, 36, is a food seller who is married to Akwasi, a 46-year-old trader. They are blessed with two children. She resides in the Dansoman community.
She has been in this business for the past 7 years and is still doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her 6th loan and she needs 1,500 GHS to expand her business and buy more cassava, plantains, vegetables, and macaroni to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, vegetables, and macaroni to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es: Vilma de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente. Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta,  Vilma esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children who are 17 and 12 years old. They are currently studying. She owns a sewing workshop in a portion of her home, where she makes different types of garments. Recently, she has gained many customers because the items she produces are excellent and she sells them at accessible prices. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, responsible, and honest.

Vilma is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy: cloth, thread, needles, and everything related to sewing, to be able to continue to satisfy the needs of her customers. Therefore, she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, cloth, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Rene David

texts.es: René de 33 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, es responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos, etc. desde hace varios años, René solicita un crédito para comprar más materiales como: hierro, laminas, varillas, materiales para soldar, etc.  ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: 33-year-old René lives in his own home together with his family group.  He is a responsible and hard-working man.  His business is making metal structures such as doors, balcony railings, gates, roofs, etc.  He has been in this business for several years.  René is requesting a loan to buy more materials such as iron, metal sheets, metal rods, welding materials, etc.  He has a lot of demand because he does a good job.  He uses the profits that he makes in his business to provide for his family and cover any expenses that occur.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal sheets, metal rods, etc.

loans.name: Ansa

texts.en:
Ansa is 33 years old, a hard-working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For eight years, Ansa has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to expand her business. She wants to purchase some more cosmetic products like make-up kits, facial scrubs, nail polish, etc., and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Ansa has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting the profit, first of all she would repay the loan amount and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some more cosmetic products like make-up kits, facial scrubs, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:
Nadia is a 27-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. 

Ten years ago, her husband started his own business of selling auto spare parts. He purchase auto spare parts and resell them at profitable prices. 

Nadia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of auto spare parts such as chains, mobile oil, tyres  and tubes, foot rests, mud guards, etc. So that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Nadia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Morena Laura

texts.es: Morena de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Ella  posee una venta de hamacas, bolsos elaborados con lana y otras obras artesanales es muy conocido por la zona pues su trabajo es muy artístico, bonito, de excelente calidad y sobre todo a muy buen precio, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente y no quiere decepcionarlos,  quiere abastecer mas su negocio con las artesanías que realiza, morena es una mujer de visión a futuro su mayor pasatiempo es trabajar, Ella sabe que tiene un don  y quiere aprovecharlo es  por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar agujas, hilos y lanas de diferentes colores, ella  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Morena is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children. She owns a business selling hammocks, purses made from yarn, and other artisanal works. She is very well-known in the area since her work is very artistic, pretty, of excellent quality, and above all sold at a good price. She has gained many customers lately and she does not want to disappoint them. She wants to stock her business with more of the artisanal products that she creates.

Morena is a woman with a vision of the future. Her biggest pastime is working. She knows that she has a talent and she wants to take advantage of it. It is because of this that she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy needles, thread, and yarn in different colors. She hopes that in this way she will be able to bring her home economic security and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, and yarn in different colors.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive con su familia. Ella posee una venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; ana es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa interior en variedad. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
41-year-old Ana lives with her family.  She has a business selling men's, women's, boys' and girls' underwear.  The clothing that she sells is very good quality and she sells everything at affordable prices.  This has gained her a lot of customers.

Ana is very active and is always working hard to get ahead in life.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a range of underwear.  This will enable her to satisfy her customers.  Ana hopes that, in this way, she will be able to provide her family with financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy a range of underwear

loans.name: Milos

texts.en:
Milos lives in a southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. He is single and 21 years old. For more than two years he has been running his own cafe bar. In his village cafe bars are rare which enables him to have more profit. Usually his customers are the younger generation who have a good time drinking coffee. 

Milos is now requesting a loan in order to add a TV, a table for billiards and to buy new inventory to satisfy the customer demand. These purchases will help him to better meet the needs of the customers from all communities in his village. Milos hopes soon to get married and have children and to save money for his future. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a TV, a table for billiards, and to buy new inventory

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
Jassem is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and has two children. Jassem and one of his children provide the family income, while the other continues his education.

Jassem is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he sells dairy products, detergents, snacks and soap. He has been in this field since 2010 and has hired an employee already. Thanks to his good customer service, Jassem has gained a good reputation in the surrounding area. 

Jassem is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store and to install an external ceiling. Jassem aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to install an external ceiling

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Ruksana is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling embroidery materials eight years ago. 

Ruksana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of embroidery material such as threads, buttons, cloth, etc., So that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Ruksana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of embroidery material to sell.

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en:
Elgiz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his father. Elgiz is 22 years old and is a single person.

He started his business 2 years ago repairing water pipes at homes and for organizations. Now Elgiz needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy needed equipment for his business. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his father, who is ill right now. In the future, Elgiz wants to get married and have a big family, because he has a person who he loves. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy equipment

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de dix  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Kanadjiguila en commune IV du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pâtes alimentaires, de condiments (boîtes de tomates concentrées, aubergine, gombo, échalote, ail, cubes jumbo, poudre de baobab, lauriers, huile, …), des produits cosmétiques, des boucles d’oreilles, barrettes, colliers, de la restauration (attiéké et poissons grillés), de la pomme de terre et de la couture. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (la 1ère  assise à gauche) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pâtes alimentaires et des boîtes de tomates concentrées dans le marché de Kanadjiguila. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 cartons de pâtes alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Bamako et  la revente se fait  au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group is made up of ten married women, who mostly live in polygamous families. They average 36 years of age and 5 children. They all live in Kanadjiguila, a neighborhood in Commune IV, Bamako District (capital of Mali).

They got acquainted through their money-earning businesses at the market in Kanadjiguila. They buy and sell pasta, condiments (tomato concentrate, eggplants, okra, shallots, garlic, Jumbo bouillon cubes, baobab tree fruit powder, bay laurel, oil, etc), cosmetics, earrings, hair clips and necklaces. They also serve food such as attiéké (fermented cassava flour), potatoes and grilled fish, and do sewing.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of this group decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which their are seeking their first group loan.

Mrs. Mariam (first one sitting on the left) has a big reputation as a seller of pasta and tomato concentrate at the market in Kanadjiguila. She intends to user her loan to buy 20 boxes of pasta.

She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Bamako. She resells for cash and on credit, at her home and at the market in Kanadjiguila, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, Mrs. Mariam hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 30-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfil. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. 

Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking out the loan for her husband, to buy a welding machine and materials like iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, iron sheets, etc. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine, etc.

loans.name: Camilia

texts.en:
Camilia is a 36-year-old Palestinian married woman, mother of four children.

Five months ago, Camilia opened a small convenience store of her own, to help her husband in making their living and covering their expenses.

Camilia showed good work and professionalism in her domain ever since she started. She is working hard to respond quickly to customers' different requests. She is applying for her fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with good standing in her paying-back history. Her applied-for loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special summer ice cream and beverages.

She hopes to develop her business and move her shop to a bigger place outside the Palestinian refugee  camp she is living in.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer ice cream and beverages

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 53-year-old married woman who is the mother of seven children. She has been working at selling clothes for ten years, but in 2009 she opened the present shop.

Her husband is working abroad in order to provide his family members with a good standard of living. Meanwhile, Salwa works hard here in Lebanon to develop her business and increase her income in order to cover her children's expenses.

Salwa is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. She hopes to keep on increasing and developing her business in a well managed way so that she can continue to respond to both her customers' and her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has three children who are still going to school. She has been running a beauty salon since 2007. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Asha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a dryer and more salon equipment, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the salon. Her dream is to one day be able to open a cosmetics shop.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the salon.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 39-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard to provide for his family.

Since 2000 her husband has been selling embroidery materials. He purchases a variety of embroidery products and resells at a profitable price.

Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of embroidery material such as threads, buttons, cloths, etc, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Shaheen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of embroidery products to sell

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 20s, is married with a small daughter.  He has been running a Genge Duka (neighborhood shop) selling fruits, vegetables and dry foods like sugar, beans, wheat flour, baking flour, salt, etc., in the same shop for six years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open the side for dry food.  Previously he used to sell fruits and vegetables and now he has a Genge Duka.  He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more sacks of Irish (white) potatoes.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group "Uwezesho" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is an Iraqi client, 43 years old, married and a father of four children. Adel is a mechanic and works hard to provide his family income from his garage. He specializes in changing engine oil and fixing tires. He has been practicing this business since 1984 and has very good experience in this field. Since Adel is old in the market, he has gained an excellent reputation.

Adel is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work. Adel is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid-30s, is single and has three children who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling art crafts for 12 years now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Hadija's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more art crafts and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to repair her house and to pay school fees.  She will use this loan to buy more and better quality art crafts.  Her dream is to one day be able to grow more and sell the art crafts abroad. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group "Glory," whose seven members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and better quality art crafts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income.

For more than eight years she has been working in her store, where she sells a variety of products including rice, sugar, pulses, flour, etc. Due to the money that she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Her greatest wish is to stock her store better, because her customers continuously ask for products which she does not have and that results in a loss of money and customers. 

Therefore, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of merchandise which will allow her to elevate her level of income and savings. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 37-year-old woman who trades in soft drinks ((Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and other sodas). She is a single mother of three children who are in school.

She has been in this business for the past three years and is doing very well. She joined ID Ghana in 2010 through another beneficiary. She is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 

She is applying for her 7th loan and needs GHS 1,800 to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and other sodas) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.en: Jumakan  is very thankful for all Kiva lenders who supported her first Kiva loan, which was very useful for her big family. She was able to enlarge her herd of cattle and purchase a small tractor for harvest transfer.  Jumakan now is applying for a second Kiva loan, directed for purchasing of a milk cow and potato seeds and crops for planting.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Marlin Suyapa

texts.es: Marlín, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en un aladea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  Marlin siempre le ha gustado el comercio, hace mas de 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas como baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, queso, crema etc.), encurtidos de vegetales, ticucos (hecho de harina de maíz condimentada relleno de frijoles) y pastelitos rellenos con carne y arroz. Ella vende su producto de manera ambulante a orilla de la carretera hacia el occidente del país donde hay mucha circulación de vehículos. Ha decidido solicitar un quinto ciclo de préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar más insumos para la elaboración de alimentos como es harina de maíz, harina de trigo, manteca, frijoles, arroz, condimentos, vegetales, y otros ingredientes necesarios. Su sueño es seguir creciendo con el negocio y estar siempre con su familia y poder establecer de nuevo una pulpería.
texts.en:
Marlín is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.

Marlín has always enjoyed the retail trade. For more than five years, she has been selling foods such as “baleadas” (a flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese, sour cream, and other ingredients), pickled vegetables, “ticucos” (cornmeal combined with beans, similar to tamales), and pastries filled with meat and rice. She sells her products as a street vendor on the edge of a road that leads to the western part of the country. There is a great deal of traffic flow.

Marlín has decided to requested her fifth loan in the amount of 25,000 HNL in order to buy more supplies for making her dishes such as cornmeal, wheat flour, lard, beans, rice, condiments, vegetables, and other necessary ingredients. Her dream is to continue growing in her business and to always be with her family. She would also like to open a new grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, wheat flour, lard, beans, rice, condiments, vegetables, and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Hilda De  La Paz

texts.es: Doña hilda de 41 años de edad, vive con sus padres y su esposo en casa propia es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña hilda solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Hilda is 41 years old. She lives with her parents and her husband in a home she owns. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who has gotten her family ahead. She has a small store where she sells bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruit, snacks and also basic necessity items such as soap, shampoo and more. Her business is in her house. Hilda is asking for a loan with which she will be able to stock her store even more so she can serve more customers and increase her sales. That is her priority to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling embroidery materials, which he has been doing for eight years. He purchases a variety of products and sells them in the market.

Safia is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase embroidery material such as threads, buttons, cloths, etc. so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Safia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery products to sell.

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en:
Hamidi is a 60-year-old married woman, mother of  three children. She has been working in her own family's bakery for 20 years.

Hamidi is a hard-working woman who puts a lot of effort into developing and improving her family's living. She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to purchase extra flour at competitive prices.

This is  her fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with good standing in her paying-back history. Hamidi is well-known in her region for the specially baked traditional breakfast bread 'Manakish' and bread with special toppings applied over it.

Hamidi hopes to buy an automatic oven that will increase her production and her income at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase extra flour at competitive prices

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 36 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three daughters. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Since 2000, her husband started selling shawls in the community which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he is interested to purchase a variety of new shawls to resell at a profitable price. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of shawls  so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Samina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shawls to resell at a profitable price.

loans.name: Consuelo Emelinda

texts.es: Doña Consuelo de 72 años de edad vive en cas propia con su esposo, ella tiene una perqueña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años vende todo tipo de productos, tiene mucha clientela pues los productos los vende a precios accesibles, doña consuelo solicita un credito par poder comprar especias por mayor como: achote, ajonjoli, albahaca, anis, apio, etc. para los diferentes alimentos pues sus clientes buscan ese producto en su tienda y con lo que le queda de ganancia no le alcanza para poder comprarlas y asi poder tener a sus clientes satisfechos cuando lleguen a comprar y ella podra tener mejores ganancias y tendra una mejor estbilidad economica.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 72, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has had a small store in her home for several years.  She sells all types of products.  She has a lot of customers because she sells at affordable prices.

Consuelo's requesting a loan to buy spices wholesale such as achiote, sesame seeds, basil, anise, celery, etc., for different foods.

Her customers look for these products in her store and what's left from her profits isn't enough to buy them.  This way her customers will be satisfied when they arrive to shop.  Also, she'll be able to earn better profits and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 63 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; marta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Doña marta  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Marta de 63 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; marta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Doña marta  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men and children

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Moría edad de 55 años  vive con su nieta en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de accesorios para uso personal como: lociones, jabones, talcos, etc. También tiene el negocio de una tienda que atiende durante el día donde sus ganancias también son buenas debido a que lleva las dos cosas a la par y por eso las ventas son numerosas tanto como las ganancias, doña Maria solicita financiamiento para la compra de lociones, perfumes, desodorantes, etc.  para poder engrandecer el negocio y lograr tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives with her granddaughter in her own home.  Her business is selling personal care products such as lotions, soap, talc etc.  She also has a store that she serves in all day.  Her sales and profits are high because she carries out both businesses in parallel.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy lotions, perfumes, deodorants, etc. so that she can expand her business and achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Prode Group

texts.es:
María es integrante de la alcancía “PRODE”, esta alcancía está conformada por 07 amigos, todos trabajadores de la misma zona. María tiene 41 años es separada con 02 hijos jóvenes, ella trabaja vendiendo carne en el mercado de su localidad, también tiene una bodega en su casa donde atiende por las tardes, su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque lo realiza todos los días de la semana y no tiene descanso, gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido brindarle a sus hijos estabilidad económica y estudios, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. En cuanto a su negocio le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en él, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar carne al por mayor para poder abastecer su negocio, mas adelante también quiere seguir mejorando la construcción de su casa. 
María quiere decir ¡Muchas gracias a todos por apoyar a nuestro grupo Comunal! En la foto es la señora que viste chompa a rayas (rojo con plomo)
texts.en:
María is a member of the “PRODE” community bank. This group is made up of 7 friends from the same area. María is 41 years old and has 2 children. She works selling meat in her community's market. She also has a store in her house where she works in the afternoon. Her work is very difficult because she does it every day of the week and has no time off. Thanks to her hard work  she has been able to offer her children financial stability and an education. Her biggest dream is for them to have good careers. With her business, she would like to keep investing in it. With the loan she has asked for she will be able to buy meat wholesale to stock her business. In the future she also wants to keep improving the construction on her home. 

María wants to say: "thank you very much for supporting our communal bank!". In the photo, she is the woman in a striped sweater (red and gray).

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Luz  es una persona muy  amable, trabajadora, y responsable con las personas que la rodean, actualmente vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus nietos, posee una tienda como negocio fuerte para ella en la cual lleva ya varios años trabajando con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña luz  solicita un crédito para poder comprar huevos, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, etc. para surtir su negocio debido a que muchas veces se queda sin mercadería y pierde de vender por falta de ello y así podrá establecer en abastecimiento su tienda para no perder clientes por la falta de producto y podrá obtener mejores ingresos y le dará a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz is a very friendly, hard-working, responsible person who lives in her own home together with her husband and grandchildren.  Her business is a store which is doing well.  She has been running it for a number of years.  She uses the profits that she makes from her sales to cover some of her household expenses.  

Luz is requesting this loan to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, etc. with which to stock her business as she sometimes finds herself without enough merchandise and therefore loses sales.  She would like to improve her stock levels so that she doesn't lose customers through a lack of goods.  This will make her better income and she will be able to provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mercedes, quien con su credikiva logró comprar telas e insumos para fabricar cubrelechos y edredones que vendió rapidamete, aumentando sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades. El número de clientes de su negocio se ha incrmentado y ella está muy satisfecha, por eso pide  a los finaciadores de Kiva que sigan apoyando con recursos a los pequeños empresarios de todo el mundo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikva, con el cual comprará telas e insumos en mayor volumen, para ganara descuentos y fabricar cubrelechos y edredones que incrmentarán su producción y generaran el éxito de su inversión pues tiene asegurado el mercado que los compra.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support Mercedes received with her Kiva loan, she was able to buy fabrics and supplies for making bedspreads and quilts, which sold rapidly. She increased her sales and was able to generate a profit. The number of customers her business serves has increased and she is very satisfied. For this reason, she asks that the Kiva lenders continue their support by providing resources to small entrepreneurs around the world.

Mercedes is currently applying for another Kiva loan in order to buy fabrics and supplies in greater volume. She will be able to obtain discounts and continue to increase her production of bedspreads and quilts. This will generate a successful investment since her products are assured of selling at the market.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies in greater volume.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Doña ana de 34 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 10  años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito  para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc.  para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados y  así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.

She works making and selling clothing.  Her business is located in her home.  Ana's an incredible and very exemplary woman because she's very hardworking, responsible, and positive.  In addition, many people recommend her and her work.

She makes a variety of garments at affordable prices.  She also offers quality in her work, which is why many people prefer her.  She has done this work for 10 years, so she has a lot of experience as well as steady customers who prefer her more every day. 

She has decided to request a loan to invest in her small business by buying the supplies she needs to make a variety of garments: fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

She does all this to give her customers better service so they feel motivated to continue requesting her services.  This way her sales and income will increase and her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: Doña Maria de 48 años de edad, es una persona amable, responsable,  vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old. She is a friendly, responsible person. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own house. She has a sewing workshop in her home where she makes different garments. She now has lots of customers because her work is excellent and she sells her garments at very accessible prices. She is very dedicated to her work, responsible and honest. Maria is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase fabric, thread, needles and everything related sewing. These items will allow her to continue satisfying the needs of her customers, so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Irma Yanira

texts.es: Doña Irma de 42 años de edad,  posee un local cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende chorizos desde hace varios años,  es una persona amable y responsable con las obligaciones que  tiene,  actualmente vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres  hijos con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  Doña Irma solicita un crédito para la compra de chorizos por mayor  para engrandecer el inventario de el negocio y que las ventas sean mayores y mas buenas para su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Irma is 42 years old. She has a locale close to her residence where she has sold sausages for several years. She is a kind person and responsible with her duties. Right now, she lives in a home she owns with her husband and three children. With the profits she makes and with her husband's help, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. Irma is asking for a loan to buy chorizos wholesale to increase her business' inventory and to have more and better sales for financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sausage wholesale

loans.name: Taban

texts.en:
Taban is a 39-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 16. All of them go to school. 

Taban runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more juice, soda, Omo (a brand of detergent) and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.

In five years, Taban would like to expand his business and open a depot.

Taban says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like juice, soda, water, Omo (detergent), etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, Fanta, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, bananas, Fanta, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sacarias

texts.es: El señor Sacarias de 40 años de edad,  casado, vive junto a su familia, son de escasos recursos económicos.  Sacarias se dedica exclusivamente a la agricultura y en tiempos libres trabaja como jornalero en diferentes parcelas de su comunidad para así poder mantener a su familia, en la anterior cosecha tuvo problemas climáticos  de sequía, causando una mala producción y  una baja calidad en sus productos e hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos a la familia que se mantienen con la producción agrícola. Cada año producen principalmente cebolla, papa  y frejol.  Este año Sacarias quiere empezar con el pie derecho y  tener una buena producción en sus cultivos es  por eso que está solicitando el crédito para comprar abono orgánico y abono químico, de esta manera mejorar la producción de cebolla y papa. Sacarias trabaja en pequeñas parcelas con su esposa, también tiene la clara idea de que con este crédito mejorará las condiciones de sus cultivos y también mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sacarias is 40 years old. He is married an lives with his family. They are of low income. Sacarias works exclusively in agriculture and in his free time works as a laborer in different land parcels in his community to support his family. In the last harvest, he had problems with drought, causing poor production and product quality. That made his family income fail, as they support themselves with farm production. Each year they grow mainly onions, potatoes and beans. This year, Sacarias wants to start out on the right foot and have good production with his crops. That is why he is asking for the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizer. This way, he can improve onion and potato production. Sacarias  works on small land parcels with his wife. He also has a clear idea that with this loan, he will improve his crops and also his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various goods such as bread, juice, water, cakes, toilet paper, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food and drinks like cakes, juice, water, tea, etc. to sell

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani is 49 years old, married, and has five children who attend school.  He lives in Juba. Wani runs a general store, which he has been doing for six years. 

Wani is requesting a loan from Finance Sudan, which he heard about through promotions by the loan officers, for 3,500 SSP, which he will use to purchase more paint, nails, and other items. In five years, Wani would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase paint, nails, and other items.

loans.name: Heylin Julissa

texts.es: La señora Heylin comerciante desde hace cuatro años, junto a su esposa sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida para darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro, su esposo trabaja para una casa privada y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella con la ganancia de sus ventas de ropa compra lo que puede de materiales para construir sus casa, a ellos se les dificulta mucho recaudar de una sola vez el dinero por los diferentes gastos que se le presentan, con este credito que se les ha otorgado comprara materiales de construccion como: Bloques, Arena, Cemento, Hierro etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conunto a Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en: Heylin has been a merchant for four years, along with her husband, so that they can improve their quality of life and give their children a better future.  Her husband works in a private home and helps her with all the household expenses.  With her earnings from her clothing sales, she was able to buy building materials to build her house.  It’s difficult for them to save all the money at once because of the various expenses they have.  This loan will allow them to buy building materials such as cinder blocks, sand, cement, iron bars, etc.  She is grateful to AFODENIC for the Kiva funds they are providing.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Kankelentigui Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Kankelentigui sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Kanadjiguila en commune IV du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques, de condiments (échalote, ail, jumbo en sachets, huile de palme, pâte d’arachide, moutarde, …) et des petits ruminants. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nina (la 1ère  debout à droite) est une grande vendeuse de petits ruminants de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 moutons à Niono. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et  au marché de Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Kankelentigui group are married and the majority live in polygamous families. They average 38 years of age with five children each. They all live in the Kanadjiguila district of Commune IV of Bamako (the capital of Mali) and know each other through relatives and their income-generating activities in Kanadjiguila market. The members of the group have businesses selling plastic kitchen utensils, condiments (shallots, garlic,
jumbo seasoning, palm oil, groundnut paste, mustard, ..) and small ruminants. With a view to increasing their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Nina (standing on the far right) is a significant seller of all types of small ruminants. She is planning to use her loan to buy four sheep in Niono. She resells for cash and on credit from home and in Kanadjiguila market to a primarily male customer base. With this loan she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, and, as is the case for all the other women in the group, this will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes, lotions, and umbrellas for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 61 años de edad ,es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Rosa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería y belleza , todos los días sale a visitar a sus diferentes amigos, vecinos y familiares para ofrecerle sus productos esperando poder vender algún perfume, talco o crema corporal, en algunas ocasiones espera que sus clientes acudan a su casa ya que tiene un amplia vitrina en donde exhibe los productos que pone a la venta, lleva realizando 9 años este trabajo y lo hace sola ya que no le gusta trabajar bajo la presión de otra persona. Complementa esta actividad vendiendo eventualmente jugos y empanadas. Durante el tiempo de que lleva trabajando aprendió mucho y reforzó algunas técnicas de venta que antes ya conocía, espera mantener su clientela estable y seguir creciendo hasta establecer una tienda de cosméticos de mayor extensión en donde pueda ofrecer a la venta más productos y tener mejores ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por productos de perfumería y cosméticos para continuar vendiendo e incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 61, is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of four children who live with her in her own home. Rosa sells cosmetics, perfumes, and beauty products. Every day she makes her sales by visiting different friends, neighbors, and relatives to offer them her products. She hopes to sell them some perfume, talcum powder, or body crème. On some occasions, she attends to customers who come to her house where she has a large display cabinet that showcases the items she sells. Rosa has been in this line of work for nine years.
