She manages her business alone and does not like working under the pressure of a boss. Rosa complements her business by selling juices and empanadas on an occasional basis. Throughout the time she has been working, Rosa has learned a great deal and is able to reinforce some of the sales techniques she learned before. She hopes to maintain a stable clientele and continue growing her cosmetics store by adding an extension where she can offer more products to sell, thereby improving her income.

For this opportunity, Rosa is requesting 1,500 PEN. She is very excited to know that there are people who are willing to provide financial support so that she can develop her business. The amount she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise, including perfumes and cosmetics, so that she can continue selling and increasing her clientele.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lorena Angelica

texts.es: lorena habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijo. ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Lorena lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and three children.  She raises corn and beans and has for several years.  She earns her living and provides the daily bread for her home.  She farms every year and it’s the only way she knows how to earn a living.  She is a very hardworking, honest, and responsible woman and she has decided to request a loan to buy the main farming supplies, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, etc., as shown in the photo.  She expects to have good results because she doesn’t have another source of income.  She trusts in God that she will be able to obtain an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue providing for her household.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to cultivate cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a few tables and plastic chairs for her home.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es: La señora Prisca vive en la comunidad de  Entre Ríos, del departamento de Cochabamba con sus tres hijos de los cuales cuida y además sus hijos le colaboran en las actividades que ella realiza. La señora trabaja  vendiendo comida tiene un restaurante que es uno de los lugares más visitados, vende comida desde hace años atrás, es muy dedicada a su actividad, prepara diferentes tipos de platos muy exquisitos y también vende diferentes variedades de refrescos,  por día realiza una venta de 50 a  100 platos en días festivos vende aún más  y refrescos de 40 a 50 unidades. La señora Prisca vive en alquiler en el segundo piso del restaurante, por lo cual con esfuerzo de su trabajo adquirió un terreno urbano donde la señora Prisca va construir su casa propia, para lo cual el capital que tiene no le alcanza para toda la construcción por tal motivo solicita el crédito para llevar a cabo toda su actividad y así vivir en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Prisca lives in the community of Entre Rios, Cochabamba Department, with her 3 children, whom she cares for.  Her children collaborate in her activities.

Prisca sells meals. She has a restaurant and it's one of the most visited local places. She has been selling meals for many years and is very dedicated to her activity. Prisca prepares different types of very rich dishes and she also sells a variety of soft drinks. Each day, she sells from 50 to 100 meals. On festival days, she sells even more, plus from 40 to 50 soft drinks.

Prisca lives in a rental apartment on the 2nd floor above her restaurant.  With great effort in her work, she has acquired an urban lot where she intends to construct her own house. The capital she has at present is insufficient to cover construction costs. That's why Prisca is requesting a loan, to carry out all this activity and, thus, be able to live in her own house.

loans.use: to cover the costs of building her own house.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is grateful to Milango for the progress the family has made through the loans issued to him.  He has been able to provide education to his family and improve the volume of his events-management business.  Timothy now looks forward to investing more in his business and is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy more seat covers.  He believes the business has improved well enough to meet the required repayments.

loans.use: to buy more seat covers.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is grateful for the previous loan that he received through Milango.  He was able to set up a clothes selling shop/business.  He now looks forward to investing more into his business.

Nelson is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of clothes for sale.  He believes the business can meet the required repayments and that he can supplement them through his formal employment earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes for sale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is glad about the progress the business is making and the impact of increased earnings.  From the humble beginnings of selling a few poultry to raise capital, the business has improved to a capital of over $1,200.

He looks forward to increasing the stock through a loan.  He is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, washing soaps, etc.  He will use the extra income to provide education to his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, washing soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new stock of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Los Rincones Group

texts.es: Grupo formado tres socias empresarias una de ellas es Lideth mujer de 35 años de edad, acompañada, hace 7 años que vende queso y cuajadas anteriormente se dedicaba a vender frutas frescas, tiene dos hijos que estudian en sus tiempos libres le ayudan en el negocio, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 13 años, los logros que a adquirido en los préstamos que le han dado es invertir en  la educación de sus hijos, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio. Este producto lo compra al por mayor en el Rama zona atlántica del país y los distribuye a los comerciantes del mercado de Masaya. Considera otro logro es la expansión de su productos a una variedad amplia de clientes  en el mercado sus ingresos aumentan. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra en la compra de queso al por mayor así como las cuajadas. Angela tiene 39 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Noelia tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pollo.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Lideth, a 35-year-old woman who is in a relationship. She has been selling cheese and curds for seven years. Lideth previously sold fresh fruit. She has two children who are studying, but they help with her business in their spare time. Lideth has been a client of ADIM for 13 years. With the income she generated from her business as a result of acquiring the loans, Lideth has been able to invest in her children’s education. Her products are purchased wholesale in Rama, an area that is on the Atlantic side of the country. She then distributes her goods to the merchants at a market in Masaya. Another achievement to consider is her expansion of products. By widening her variety, she has grown her customer base at the market and her income has increased. Lideth’s loan will be invested in the purchase of cheese in bulk, as well as curds.

Angela is 39 years old and has a grocery business in her home. Noelia is 20 years old and has a business of selling chicken.

loans.use: to buy cheese and curds in bulk.

loans.name: Isunga Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Berna is a 50-year-old widow with 7 children who stay with her.  After the death of her husband, she started a small bar in her village to raise money to look after the family.  She also practices agriculture on a smaller scale to address her family’s needs and to sell the surplus. 

Berna wants a loan of 200,000 to buy organic manure to spread into her banana plantation.  She hopes that with the manure the quality of her plantation will improve as well as her productivity and sales.  This, in turn, will increase her income which will enable her to educate her children and to have a decent living environment for the family.  However, she is challenged by the limited capital as well as the bad weather that always affects agriculture.  

The eleventh person standing in the back of the photo is the Ugafode credit officer

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Vicetnta

texts.en:
Vicetnta is a 29-year-old mother with two children who is married to Joseph, a 37-year-old mason. She has been in the trade of selling slippers, bags and cosmetics for the past three years in the Dansoman community of Ghana. She is doing an excellent job and is hardworking and industrious.

Vicetnta joined ID Ghana in 2012 when a friend introduced it to her. This is her 3rd loan and she needs an amount of 1,000 Ghana cedis (GHS) to buy more slippers, bags and cosmetics to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, bags and cosmetics to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is happy about being a client of Milango. The transportation business has improved and she was also able to set up a boutique and a food stall. Her challenges now are a small business space and food spoilage. She is therefore applying for a loan of 62,650 KES to purchase a deep freezer for food storage. She looks forward to a more fruitful season ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for food storage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase much needed stock, including Ethiopian spices and specialty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items, such as sugar and flour, to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four school-going children. She started her farming business from her own savings and then applied for a loan, which she used to buy another animal.

Irene is faced with the challenges of limited space in her current cow shed and a lack of a food store. She is therefore applying for a loan of 93,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to construct a shed and a feed store. This will assist her to store enough feed for use during dry seasons.

The extra income that Irene earns will go towards her children’s education and feed stock.

loans.use: To construct a shed and a feed store.

loans.name: Lluvia De La Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Minerva is the coordinator of her group 'Lluvia de Bendiciones' (Blessing rain) 1, 2 & 3. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 8 dependents. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard to provide for her children and family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home with her family, and to attend to the church. 

Minerva is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanding her business. She has had her business for over 5 years, starting with her own saving loan with which she bought a stove and gas tank to fry food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses to increase her inventory by purchasing goods like flour, meat, plantains, potatoes, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and to provide for her family. She wants to have her family together in a better house.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has two children.  He is the manager of a production/training company that teachers high-school students.  He has been working there for 10 years.  Yaroslav also just loves farming.  He is a hardworking, persistent, and responsible person.

Yaroslav is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to repair his bathroom and living room.  The loan will help to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to repair his bathroom and living room.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en: Juan Carlos, pictured with his wife, is a farmer from Morelos who cares about the environment. When he decided to open a new slaughterhouse in his municipality, there was significant concern over the waste and odors that would be generated from the blood and manure. Historically, farmers in the region have dumped their waste wherever convenient, polluting watersheds and hurting local biodiversity. Juan Carlos wanted to avoid that and is investing in his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to make sure he doesn't do the same. He will process the waste produced by his slaughterhouse to generate high quality biofertilizer and renewable, methane-rich biogas, reducing his impact on multiple levels: reduced agrochemical fertilizer usage, reduced fossil fuel use, and mitigation of environmental damage caused by properly treating the waste produced on his site. This loan represents 55% of the total price of his system.

loans.use: To purchase a 120-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother with three children.  She lives in her home built with a simple structure, like others in her community.  Sonia lives with her children in the North area from Santo Domingo city, in one of the rural/slum areas around the main city. 

Sonia says her most favorite things to do are to take care of her children and play with them.  Her most important challenge is to continue growing in her life and business.  Since two years ago, Sonia started her clothing sales business with the money she could save from different activities.  Now she is receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital in her business.  The loan will be used to buy new clothes, cosmetics, shoes and other miscellaneous products.

With her profits, she will reinvest in her business.  She dreams of having a general store in a better location.  Sonia and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores, etc.  Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Group Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 (True God).  This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris.  Juana sells silver and gold jewelry.  This is the 12th loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase more jewelry and clothes to expand her business inventory. 

She is very excited about these loans.  They made it possible for her to start a business almost six years ago, and she is still running it.  She continues to expand her sales into more products and clients.  Juana tells us that her challenge is to have a sustainable business, to be able to provide for her four children, and to help her long-term partner with extra income.  Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business.  She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and accessories.

loans.name: Richmie

texts.en: Richmie is a 28-year-old woman living in Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She has been managing a transportation business for four years. She earns 7,500 PHP a month. In 2008, she became a member of GDMPC Micro-Credit and is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a transportation vehicle to improve the business. In the future, she dreams to have an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Daisy Alida

texts.es: La Sra. Daisy es comerciante, hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a su actividad, vende todo tipo de material de escritorio, escolar y regalos para acontecimientos importantes, solicita un crédito Kiva para incrementar su capital de operación, es decir quiere comprar más regalos para el día de la madre que ya está cerca por ello se aconseja otorgarle este crédito para que la sra. Daisy pueda seguir trabajando con su actividad y generar mayor ingresos económicos, de estado civil viuda, no tiene hijos vive en su casa sola, inmueble que lo alquila la parte de la primera planta a personas que también se dedican al comercio. Según declaro la sra. Daisy, necesita urgente este dinero para no perder la oportunidad de poder aumentar su mercadería ya que por ahora esta barata y no quiere que se le aumente en el mes que viene por el día de la madre ya que es el mes donde vende más a comparación de los otros meses.
texts.en:
Sra. Daisy is a merchant and has been in business for more than six years. She sells all types of writing materials, school supplies, and gifts for important occasions. Daisy is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase her operating capital. She says that she wants to buy more gifts for Mother’s Day since that time is approaching. For this reason, it was recommended that she apply for a loan so that she can continue working in her business and generate more income.

Sra. Daisy is a widow and has no children. She lives alone in her house. Daisy rents out part of the first floor to people who are also merchants. According to her, she is in urgent need of the money because she does not want to lose this opportunity to increase her inventory since prices are low at the moment and will go up in the next month right before Mother’s Day. During that month, she sells more when compared to other months.

loans.use: to buy gifts to sell for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Iris Ivette

texts.es: Doña iris es comerciante, vive con su esposo y sus tres  hijos en casa propia y ella se dedica  ala venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña iris pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar
texts.en:
Iris is a merchant.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own house and she works selling fast-food like fried potatoes, fried manioc, turnovers, tamales, etc. from place to place near her house.  Thanks to her sales, she’s been able to cover her household expenses.  

Iris is asking for financing to buy the ingredients she uses like oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, bananas and everything else she needs to make the fast-food snacks so that she can continue supporting her home and covering expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Alexandra María

texts.es: Alexandra de 32 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad, al cual sueña con brindarle la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad y verlo convertido en un gran profesional. Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que le genera los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida, Alexandra se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos, lo que le permitirá garantizar una mejor condición económica y estabilidad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 32, is a single mother of a 16-year-old son; she dreams with providing him with the opportunity of going to university and becoming a great professional.  For some years now she’s been selling fast-food, an activity that generates resources to support her family.

Aiming at increasing sales and improving her quality of life, Alexandra is requesting a loan to buy ingredients which will allow her to guarantee a better economic condition and stability for her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for fast-food.

loans.name: Tarcela's Group

texts.en:
Tarcela is 62 years old and married with 5 children.  She lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.  Tarcela grows assorted crops for a living.  She has been doing this activity for 20 years and earning a monthly income of 4,300.  Tarcela is requesting a new loan to purchase construction materials for house completion.  Tarcela has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 6 years.

Tarcela is the leader of the 2-member group but they have separate responsibilities.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house completion.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda is 61 years old and married with 6 children.  She lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.  Lyda has a shop that sells groceries and beverages.  She is able to generate a monthly income of 5,200 from this business.  She has been doing this for almost 20 years. 

Lyda has requested a new loan to purchase 20 boxes of grocery items and beverages as additional stock to sell.  Lyda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of grocery items and 20 cases of beverages.

loans.name: Emprendedoras En Accion Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras en Acción es una alcancía formada por 06 amigos. Ana María es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 51 años es casada con 02 hijos y 02 nietos, vive en casa de su suegra con toda su familia. Ana María es costurera, fueron sus primas quienes hace 06 años le enseñaron este oficio, ahora confecciona prendas de vestir en su domicilio y está orgullosa de su trabajo porque gracias a eso puede  sostenerse y ayudar a su esposo. Sus clientas son amigas y vecinas de su localidad que siempre solicitan sus servicios. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar materiales para sus confecciones como telas e hilos, está muy entusiasmada por este préstamo y agradecida al saber que personas que no la conocen la ayudaran tanto a ella como a su grupo comunal.
Ana María aparece en la foto con polo amarillo.
texts.en:
“Emprendedoras en Acción” (Entrepreneurs in Action) is a Communal Bank that consists of six friends. Ana María is the group president. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children and two grandchildren. Ana María lives at her mother-in-law’s house with her entire family. She is a seamstress and learned this trade from her cousins six years ago. Now she produces clothing from her home and is proud of her work because she can support herself and help her husband. Her customers are friends and neighbors from her town who are always requesting her services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and thread. She is very excited about this loan and is grateful that people who do not know her are willing to help her and the other members of her Communal Bank.

In the photo, Ana María is wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Doris Nubia

texts.es:
Doris, de 34 años, es una valiente que con su esfuerzo y dedicación ha alcanzado muchos de sus sueños. Asegura que se ha enfrentado a  grandes pruebas en la vida, pero con el amor por su familia ha superado los obstáculos. En la actualidad tiene una sala de internet y una miscelánea, en donde presta entre otros los servicios de fotocopias. Gracias al desarrollo de su actividad su familia goza de mejores condiciones de vida. 
Con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y ofrecer un mejor servicio, Doris se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía como papelería y artículos para celulares. 
Sueña con expandir su negocio y crecer dentro del mercado local para garantizarle a su familia una condición económica estable.
texts.en:
Doris, 34, is a brave woman who with her effort and dedication has reached many of her dreams.   She insists that she’s faced great trials in life but with love for her family has been able to overcome them.  She currently has an Internet access service and a miscellany store where she provides photocopying services.  Thanks to this activity’s development her family enjoys better living conditions.

Aiming at increasing sales levels and offering better service, Doris is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like stationery supplies and items for mobile phones.  She dreams with expanding the business and growing in the marketplace to guarantee a condition of economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies and mobile phone items.

loans.name: Norey

texts.en:
Norey is married and has two children. She is 26 years old and lives in Nazareth, Pagadian City ZDS. 

Norey sells t-shirts and polo shirts to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. She also has a videoke machine that earns her additional income. Each month she earns about 9,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase new ready-to-wear clothes.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future she hopes to have her own stall to display her products.

loans.use: To purchase new ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, su esposa y sus padres, el se dedica a tomar fotos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia  tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad, tiene mucha clientela ya que es una persona amable y realiza un buen trabajo,  don José solicita un crédito para comprar materiales fotográficos como papel, rollos y otros instrumentos para su trabajo y así seguir  dándole lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Don José is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his three children, his wife, and his parents. He is in the business of taking photographs. His business is located in his home and he has been in this line of work for several years. José has many clients since he is a friendly person who does good work.

Don José is requesting a loan so that he can buy photography supplies such as paper, rolls of film, and other instruments for his work. As a result, he can continue providing for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy paper, rolls of film, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Amigas Unidas” esta conformada por 05  mujeres carismáticas, que el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando sus negocios con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ydelvina de 33 años es separada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad (3-5). Ydelvina comenzó trabajando en una peluquería con los conocimientos que adquirió y los deseos de superación toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio donde actualmente cuenta con un salón de belleza la cual brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, manicure, pintados entre otros. Su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de tintes, tijeras y una mesa donde pueda atender. El grupo “Amigas Unidas” agradecen el crédito brindado. Ydelvina es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color rosado y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
The “Amigas Unidas” (United Girlfriends) communal bank is composed of five, charismatic women who as time has passed have been improving their businesses aiming at improving the quality of life of their families.  Ydelvina, 33, is separated and has two minor children (3 and 5).  Ydelvina started working in a barber shop and with the skills she learned and the drive to improve she decided to open her own business.  She currently owns a beauty salon where she provides haircuts, manicure and hair styling, among other services.  Her greatest wish is to own a house.

She will use the requested loan to buy hair color, scissors and a table to tend from.  Ydelvina is third from the left wearing a pink shirt and blue pants.

The “Amigas Unidas” group is grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy hair color, scissors and a table.

loans.name: Micaela Bastida Ii Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres  emprendedoras    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “MICAELA BASTIDA II”.La Sra. Toribia  de 39 años de edad casada  y madre de  4 hijos, ella se dedica hace 3 años  al reciclaje de papel  La Sra. Toribia nos cuenta que con mucho empeño y trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo ah ido generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un pequeño almacén  propio donde poder almacenar  sus papeles y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en ampliar su local de reciclaje de papel y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Toribia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Toribia  se encuentra parada en el medio se distingue  con un polo manga larga de color marrón, se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The community group “Micaela Bastida II” is made up of eight women entrepreneurs with a lot of creativity for business. Toribia is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She has worked for three years recycling paper. Toribia tells us that with a lot of hard work and the help of her husband, she has been earning income to cover household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own small storage space where she could store her papers and therefore improve her income.

Toribia is requesting this loan to increase the size of the location she uses for her paper recycling business, which she says will help her get ahead. Toribia and all of the members of the group say they are very grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that has been placed in them. Toribia can be seen in the middle of the photograph in the brown long-sleeved polo shirt. She would like to close this message by giving her promise that she will comply with all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to increase the size of the location she uses for her paper recycling business.

loans.name: Oshita's Group

texts.en: Oshita is 56 years old, single and has no children. She lives in Del Pilar, Baliangao, where she earns a living by selling beauty soap and other products. She has been in this business for a year and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional supplies to sell. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for nine years and leads a two-person loan group.

loans.use: to buy beauty soaps and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rubio

texts.en:
Rubio is 23 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a poultry business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase feed for the chicken. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the chicken.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is 36 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

Silvina feels better now that she has applied for her first loan of $ 600.00 She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as gasoline (petrol). She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy petrol

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy supplies for her electronic repairs.

Flora successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her electronic repair shop business.

NWTF is re-listing Flora's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her electronic repair shop

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do was born in 1962. He has two children. They are laborers. He and his wife are farmers. They raise chickens and ducks. His income is about 3,000,000 VND. The total earnings of his family are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

He has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, he would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND, which he will use to raise pigs and ducks. He hopes he can raise more pigs and more ducks than before.

loans.use: to raise pigs and ducks.

loans.name: María Yeni

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de fritos en su barrio cerca al colegio, lugar estratégico para la venta de sus productos. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena hasta horas de la tarde. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nevera con el fin de adquirir productos perecederos al por mayor y almacenarlos con el fin de evitar su descomposición. 
Asegura que con dicha inversión mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y podrá ofrecerle a su hijo de 14 años una mejor educación.
Sueña con poder establecer su negocio en un local para evitar las pérdidas que le genera el mal clima.
texts.en:
María, 39, makes a living selling fried snacks in her neighborhood near the school, a strategic location to sell her products.  She gets up very early every day to start her job and works until the afternoon.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in buying a refrigerator to acquire perishable products wholesale and store them so they won't go bad.

She's certain that with this investment she'll improve her family's quality of life and be able to give her 14-year-old son a better education.

She dreams of being able to set up her business in a place where she can avoid the losses she suffers from bad weather.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en: Aida is 40 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba where she earns a living by selling vegetables and spices. She has been in this business for almost six years and earns an income of PHP 3,600 a month. Aida is requesting a new loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2004 and also leads a three-person loan group.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of assorted vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi was born in 1967. She has one child who is a barber. She is a single mother. She raises chickens and earns about 2,000,000 (VND) per month. The total earnings of her family are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for chickens and grow rice. She wants to buy more furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and grow rice

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es: Mónica es una madre de 27 años de edad, separada con 01 hijo dependiente.  Ella es integrante del grupo “Caminando Juntos” conformada por  06 socios emprendedores. Desde muy joven Mónica se ha dedicado al comercio, pues se inició en la venta de frutas. Con el trascurso del tiempo y siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre decide emprender el negocio de la compra y venta de queso. Actualmente le va bien en su negocio, pues tiene clientes fijos. Posteriormente tiene como meta instalar su tienda de embutidos. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de quesos, ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. Mónica junto al grupo “Caminando Juntos” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por colaborar en su progreso. Mónica   se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
Mónica’s a 27-year-old mother; she’s separated and has one dependent child.  She’s a member of the “Caminando Juntos” (Walking Together) group which has six enterprising members.  

Since a very young age, Mónica has been in commerce having started out selling fruit.  As time passed and following her mother’s example, she decided to start a business buying and selling cheese.  She’s currently doing well in her business because she has regular customers.  Later on, her goal is to open a cured meats store.  She requested the loan to buy cheese since she has pending orders to fill.  Mónica is seated, first on the left, wearing a black jacket.

Mónica as well as the “Caminando Juntos” group are grateful to Kiva lenders for collaborating with their progress.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 49 years old and lives in Manaka, Ozamiz City with her four children. She earns PHP 2,000 a month, but this is not enough to pay her daily expenses. To earn more money, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to plant on vacant land. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2002 and plans to use this loan for PHP 4,500 to double her income by planting these new crops.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: Margarita es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando Para El Futuro”  la cual lo conforma 06 personas responsables dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Margarita lleva más de 10 años  dedicándose  a la venta de comida en las afueras de un colegio, siendo sus mayores clientes alumnos del colegio. Actualmente sus ingresos lo destinan para cubrir los gastos del hogar e insumos de su negocio.  Margarita es una madre trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a  su familia.  Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como papa, arroz, aceite, ensaladas y azúcar. Margarita de 57 años es separada y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. El grupo  “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradecen el crédito brindado. Margarita está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo celeste con chaleco marón y pantalón color rojo. Gloria no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank “Trabajando Para El Futuro” [“Working for the Future”], which is made up of six responsible people all dedicated to their different commercial activities. Margarita has worked for 10 years now selling food near a school, the students of which are her principal customers. At the moment she is using her income to cover household expenses and the ingredients she needs for her business. Margarita is a very hardworking mother who, with a lot of effort, has been able to provide for her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children established in careers. Margarita will use this loan to buy ingredients such as potatoes, rice, oil, salads and sugar. Margarita is 57 years old, separated, and has four children. She continues to support one of her children.

The “Trabajando Para El Future” group is grateful for this loan. Margarita can be seen at the back of the photograph, the first from the left, wearing a light blue polo shirt with a brown vest and red pants. Gloria was not able to be present because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as potatoes, rice, oil, salads and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña Maria vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia donde vende artículos de primera necesidad desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona muy atenta cuando le llegan a comprar y  también porque tiene la tienda muy surtida, ella quiere acrecentar su negocio al ver que tiene mucha demanda, por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar huevos, granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, también shampoos, jabones, etc. para poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María lives with her family in her own house.  She has a grocery store at home where she’s sold sells basic staple items for several years.  She has a large clientele because she’s a very service-oriented person when they come by to buy and also because she has a very well-stocked store.  

She wants to enlarge her business because she’s aware of high demand which is why she’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for her to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, snacks and also shampoo, soap, etc. to earn higher profits and to provide for her family with no limitation whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aleth  Cecilia

texts.es: Arlet de 31 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 2 años a prestar servicios de belleza en una peluquería ubicada cerca de su residencia. Trabaja de 9:00 a.m a 8:00 p.m de lunes a sábado. El desarrollo de esta actividad se ha constituido en su única fuente de ingresos, con la cual sostiene a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Sueña con brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro y a sus hijos una educación de calidad. Motivo que la ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza como tratamientos, alisers y una vitrina. Espera que con dicha inversión sus ventas incrementen y su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en: Arlet, 31, has been providing beauty services in a barber shop near her house for the last two years.  She works from 9am until 8pm, Monday through Saturday.  The development of this activity has become her sole source of income she uses to support her three minor children.  She dreams with providing a better future and a quality education for her children which has motivated her to request a loan to buy beauty supplies like hair treatment, straighteners and a display case.  She hopes with said investment that her sales will increase and her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and a display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barber shop accessories and a display cabinet

loans.name: Alexandra Milena

texts.es:
Alexandra de 32 años de edad, es una mujer que sabe como ganarse la vida y sacar su familia adelante, con su pujanza y esfuerzo logró montar su negocio y posicionarlo en su sector. Desde hace más de tres años tiene una heladería, la cual es su única fuente de ingresos. Asegura que el nivel de ventas ha aumentado, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtito y un refrigerador para ofrecer un servicio de calidad y seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local.
Sueña con tener una cadena de heladerías, mejorar su condición económica y el nivel de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 32, is a woman who knows how to earn a living and get her family ahead.  With her strength and effort she managed to set up and position her business in her area.  For more than three years she has had an ice cream shop, which is her only source of income.

She's certain her sales have increase, so she's requesting a loan to invest in buying supplies and a refrigerator to give quality service and continue growing in the local market.

She dreams of having a chain of ice cream shops and improving her financial status and the standard of living in her household.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a refrigerator

loans.name: Yecenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yecenia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia  con sus dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, ella  tiene un negocio de antojitos, yuca frita, empanadas, papas fritas, pastelitos relleno de carne, etc. desde hace varios años, tiene mucha cliente por ser una persona amable y limpia cuando elabora sus alimentos, yecenia  solicita un crédito para comprar papas, plátanos, vegetales, yuca, tomates, etc.  y así seguir con su trabajo y poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Yecenia, 35, lives with her two children aged 13 and 9 who are attending school at present in her own house.  She has had a business selling fast-food snacks, fried manioc, turnovers, fried potatoes, little meat-filled pies, etc. for several years.  She has many customers because she’s a kind person and she prepares her dishes hygienically.  

Yecenia’s asking for a loan to buy potatoes, bananas, vegetables, manioc, tomatoes, etc. to continue with her work and to be able to provide her family with what they need with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, vegetables, manioc, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ninive Holanda

texts.es: Doña ninive de 40 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad como: granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, etc. desde 8 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra sacar adelante a su familia, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia y es por ellos que se esfuerza dia a dia por salir adelante. Doña ninive  solicita un crédito para poder surtir su negocio con mas ropa y productos para su tienda y asi seguirle dando a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan sin limitaciones.
texts.en:
Ninive, 40, has had a business selling clothes and basic staple goods like basic grains, oil, sugar, etc. for the last 8 years.  She’s able to support her family thanks to the profits she earns.  She lives with her two children in her own house and she strives daily for them in order to get ahead. 

Ninive is asking for a loan to be able to stock her business with more clothes and other products for her store to continue providing for her children with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy clothes and basic staple goods.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doña Josefa de 60 años de edad se dedica a vender fruta cerca de un centro educativo que está en su lugar de residencia tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad tiene mucha clientela pues son los estudiantes quienes la buscan por vender su fruta fresca y a buen precio por eso doña Josefa solicita un crédito para poder comprar fruta por mayor, y los preparativos que le pone a la fruta como: chile, limones, sal, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y seguir llevando lo necesario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Josefa is 60 years old and her business is selling fruit near a local school.  She has been in this business for a number of years and has a lot of customers.  Her customers are students who buy from her because she sells fresh fruit at a good price.

Josefa is requesting a loan to buy fruit wholesale.  She will also buy other products for adding to her fruit such as chili peppers, lemons, salt, etc.  This will make her better profits and she will be able to continue providing for her household.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale and to buy other products for adding to her fruit such as chili peppers, lemons, salt, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Cecilia de la edad de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las obligaciones que tiene, actualmente vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes estudian actualmente,  se dedica a la venta de tamales que ella elabora, tiene ya varios años de elaborar los tamales por lo que es muy conocida y apreciada por todos los vecinos de la zona los cuales son los clientes con quien ella vende su producto, Doña Cecilia solicita financiamiento para la compra de todos los ingredientes para elaborar sus tamales como: maíz, pollo, tomates, hojas para envolver los tamales, etc.  para seguir haciendo los tamales que es lo que le genera las mejores ganancias y así le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 31, is a hardworking woman who takes the responsibilities she has seriously.  She currently lives in her own house with her husband and three children who are attending school at present.  She works selling tamales she makes.  She’s been making tamales for years now so she’s very well-known and well-liked by all the neighbors in her zone who are her customers and to whom she sells her product.

Cecilia’s requesting financing to buy all the ingredients she needs to make tamales like corn, chicken, tomatoes, leaves to wrap the tamales, etc. to continue making tamales that generate good profits so she can continue providing better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, tomatoes, leaves to wrap tamales, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora, 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Esparta Atlántida. Doña Pastora siempre se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de comida, ella alquila un local donde tiene establecido su negocio. Vende variedad de comidas, como almuerzos, licuados, churros, galletas, refrescos, y comidas rápidas. Ha decidido solicitar un cuarto préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para poder comprar un frízer que necesita para su negocio, porque el que tiene esta en mal estado. Su plan es llegar a tener un comedor bien acondicionado y construir algunos apartamentos  para alquiler y obtener otros ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pastora is 54 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her family in a village within the the town of Esparta Atlántida.  Pastora has always been working in the business of selling food.  She rents a space where she has set and sells a variety of foods, such as lunches, smoothies, churros, cookies, drinks, and fast food.  She has decided to ask for a loan of 11,000 Lempiras so she can buy a freezer that she needs for her business, because the one she has is in bad shape.  Her plan is to have a well set up dining room and also acquire some apartments to rent out so she can have another source of income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Doña gladis de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su de 13 años  de edad, el estudia actualmente, Doña Gladis  se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Gladis  solicita un crédito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su hijo.
texts.en:
Gladis, 54, lives in her own house with her 13-year-old son who attends school at present.  Gladis works selling tortillas at home; she’s worked Monday to Sunday for several years and has a large clientele because she’s kind and very hardworking.  She uses profits earned to cover her household expenses.

Gladis requests a loan to buy corn by the quintal to continue making tortillas and earn higher profits to have better economic stability with her son.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is married with five children. She is requesting a loan of (USD) $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a second-hand goods shop that generate income for her family and wants to run a successful business but lacks working capital. She applied for her first loan to buy some additional items to sell in her store such as second-hand clothes, shoes and handbags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offering loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: A USD $1,200 loan is offered to Eliza to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy grocery items every day. She will buy some additional items such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee and also a refrigerator for keeping drinks. She has been in business since 2008. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. This business has made Eliza independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and a refrigerator for keeping drinks.

loans.name: Jesielle

texts.en: Jesielle of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental is 33 years old, married and has two children. She owns and manages a sari sari (convenience) store selling grocery products in the local community and earns 3,500 PHP monthly. In 2012, she became a member of GDMPC micro credit and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new grocery items to expand her product offerings. She dreams to have a comfortable house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new grocery items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. Ledesma has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and she earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Ledesma has requested a loan to  purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other items. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Ledesma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store of items such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and other consumable products

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Doña Amanda de 63  años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas quienes trabajan de maestras en un centro escolar cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella se dedica a elabora antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos, etc. que vende de forma ambulante en las colonias aledañas. Pide financiamiento para la compra de materia prima: fruta fresca, aceite, etc. y para mejorar la cocina que es la que muestra en la fotografía pues ahí es donde elabora sus alimentos para seguir con su negocio y poder seguir llevando el sustento diario a su casa.
texts.en:
Amanda, 63, lives in her own home with her two daughters who work as teachers in a school near to their place of residence. Amanda makes her living making antojitos [snacks] such as toasts with slices of fried potato, yucca, plantain and so on, which she sells in the streets in neighboring areas.

Amanda is seeking financing to buy ingredients: fresh fruit, oil and so on to improve her kitchen which is what she is showing in the photograph: this is where she makes the food to continue with her business and continue providing the daily sustenance in her home.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit, oil and so on to improve her kitchen.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Doña rosa vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia su hijo menor tiene educación especial y su hija es la que le ayuda en las ventas, pues  ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 35 años en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña rosa esta solicitando un crédito que le permita poder comprar mas mercadería como:  Pantalones, camisas, blusas, shorts y todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio ya que tiene buena clientela porque vende ropa de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, y asi poder seguir con su negocio y seguirá llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her two children in her own house; her youngest son is in special education and her daughter helps her with sales.  She’s had a business selling clothes in a market near her house for the last 35 years.  With the sales she does she’s able to cover her household expenses.  

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like pants, shirts, blouses, shorts and everything needed to stock her business since she has a good clientele because she sells very good quality clothes at affordable prices and thus be able to stay in business and continue providing daily sustenance for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is married with five children. She is 52 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. 

For five years, Rosalyn has owned and managed a general store, earning PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to purchase bottled products, canned goods and rice and corn grits for sale. Rosalyn has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rosalyn's plan is to save her returns in order to support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bottled products, canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is 40 years and is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She would like to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital so she applied for her first loan. With it, she will buy some additional items to keep in her store such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy, soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for her jeepney.* The loan also helped in the education of her children and in her household expenditures. She has had this business for ten years already. She and her husband woek hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

Eufemia would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help cover her family's daily needs and pay for her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia dreams that her business will expand and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members** every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the word of God, which she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Crisencio

texts.en:
This is Crisencio. He previously received a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of his Jeepney* unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

Crisencio would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover his family's daily needs and pay for his children's education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Crosencio hopes to have more jeepneys and dreams that his children will have a good life and education. He meets every week with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies. 

* Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known for their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Filipino culture. 

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop.

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es: Rosa  de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, tiene un negocio de venta de tortas desde hace 4 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, rosa solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, lives with her life partner and their two children in their own home. She has been running a snack stall for four years and has a good customer base as she sells her food at a good price. Her business is located near her place of residence and she helps with the household expenditure with the profits that she makes. 

Rosa is seeking a loan to enable her to buy everything she needs to make her snacks such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausages and other ingredients. In doing so, she will be able to have better profits and continue helping with the costs that may arise in the household.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, sausages and so on.

loans.name: Douglas Omar

texts.es: Don Douglas de 35 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de medicina natural desde hace  15 años, vende de forma ambulante por las colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus medicamentos son de muy buena calidad y aprecios realmente accesibles, con las ganancia que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que su familia tiene vive con su esposa y sus tre hijos en casa propia. Don Douglas esta solicitando un crédito que le permita poder comprar mas medicinas por mayor  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  y asi poder seguir llevando el alimento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Douglas, 35, has been selling natural remedies for 15 years.  He sells them from place to place in neighborhoods near his place of residence.  He has a large clientele because his medicine is very good quality and his prices are really affordable.  With profits earned he’s able to cover some of his family’s expenses.  He lives with his wife and three children in his own house.

Douglas is requesting a loan that will make it possible for him to buy more medicine at wholesale since this is his only source of work and he will thus be able to continue providing his home with daily food.

loans.use: to buy medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: doña rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de medicinas  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela pues vende medicamentos de muy buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, doña rosa solicita un crédito para la compra de mas medicamentos por mayor  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi ella podrá tener una mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She works selling medicine and her business has been home-based for several years.  She has many customers because she sells good quality medicine at very affordable prices.  With profits earned she manages to cover her household expenses.

Rosa’s asking for a loan to buy more medicine at wholesale since this is her only source of work and she’ll be able to earn higher profits so her family can have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Jay Sriram Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, five women from M. Rampur town in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India formed a group named Jay Sriram to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Tapaswini, the head strong lady, is one of them. The lady standing on the extreme left in the photo raising her hand is Tapaswini. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter.
 
Tapaswini has been running a Tiffin stall for the last 10 years with the hand holding support of her husband. Initially, Tapaswni started this business with her small investment. Gradually she developed her Tiffin stall business with the loan support from Mahashakti Foundation. As of today, she has taken three loans from Mahashakti and successfully expanded her business. The sweet items from her stall are very popular in the locality. Tapaswini gets a monthly income of 7,000 INR from the business. Out of this income, she is barely able to manage her household expenses along with her business expenses. So she wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.  From the present loan of 36,000 INR, Tapaswini wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she has to replenish her stock frequently. She also wants to use some portion of the loan to repair her Tiffin stall. Tapaswini hopes to save enough to build a good house of her own and give a better education to her only girl child.
 
The other four members of the group are Damayanti, Smitarani (who is running a daily needs and betel shop), Gayatri (who is running a medicine store) and Pankajini (who is running a barber shop).

loans.use: To purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia, a licensed esthetician with over 750 hours of training in esthetics and product formulation, understands the importance of discipline and dedication to her goals.  She has been equipped with the knowledge and skills to help her succeed in her newest role as owner and operator of SophiaK Essentials.

The home-based spa offers customers high-end, anti-aging and effective esthetic treatments using natural skincare products Sophia creates.  At the spa, customers can receive microdermabrasion treatments, chemical peels, waxing, eyelash extension, and advanced facial care.  All ingredients are formulated naturally and hypoallergenic with you in mind.  

In 2007, Sophia established her company as she began creating homemade creams, lotions and oils for her new product line.  Sophia’s goal to grow her business led her to apply for a loan at Accion Texas Inc.  The loan she received allowed Sophia to purchase ingredients to formulate her lotions and oils, folding tables, decorations for her home-based spa and maintenance on equipment used to perform facials, microdermabrasion, and chemical peels on customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to formulate her lotions and oils, folding tables, decorations for her home-based spa and maintenance on equipment that perform facials, microdermabrasion, and chemical peels on customers.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the gardening materials and fertilizer needed in her business. Her income helped in the education of her children as well as in her household. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

Angelina would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets, garden inputs, and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her cover her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Angelina hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her family will always be happy and complete. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Ben Asher

texts.en:
Ben Asher is a 29-year-old man.  He is married, has one child, and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He earns 4,000 PHP monthly with the transportation services business he has had for three years. 

In 2012, Ben Asher became a member of GDMPC microcredit and he is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. In the future, he plans to build a house using his income.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Evangelines Group

texts.en:
Evangeline is 66 years old and lives in Anex, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 16 adult children. To earn a living, Evangeline runs a business selling canned goods, rice, detergents, noodles, etc. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month from her store. 

Evangeline requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more items including cartons of mosquito killer, detergent, powder soft, beverages, and sacks of rice. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evangeline would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items including cartons of mosquito killer, detergent, powder soft, beverages, and sacks of rice

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Violeta is married and has five children. She lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Violeta sells used clothes to earn for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Violeta has requested a loan to purchase used cloth for her clothing business. She has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Violeta hopes to have her own trademark on the dresses she makes.

loans.use: to purchase used cloth for her clothing business

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Lorenca

texts.en:
Lorenca is applying for a loan of $1.200.00 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as biscuits, oil, sugar and slippers.
Lorenca opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $400.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, oil, sugar and slippers.

loans.name: Prosperidad Leal Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Prosperidad Leal” conformada por 06 mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras. Siendo Vanessa una de las integrantes. Ella es casada con 02 hijos menores de edad. A sus 32 años se siente feliz de haber cumplido con algunos de sus sueños como apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y mantener su negocio. Vanessa se dedica a la venta de conservas de filete decidió iniciar dicho negocio con la idea de independizarse y así poder brindarles más tiempo a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de tener su casa propia, ya que por el momento vive en casa de sus familiares. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá para la compra de conservas de filetes y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes. El grupo “Prosperidad Leal” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.  Vanessa se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro. La socia Zoila no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo
texts.en:
This is the “Prosperidad Leal” (Loyal Prosperity) group made up of six dynamic and enterprising women. Vanessa is one of the members. She is married and has two children under the age of 18. At 32 years old, Vanessa feels happy about having achieved some of her dreams such as supporting her children in their education and running her business. Vanessa makes her living selling tinned fish fillets, she started this business with the aim of becoming self-sufficient and therein be able to dedicate more time to her children. Her greatest dream is to have her own home, given that at the moment she lives in a relative's home. The loan she is seeking is to invest in the purchase of tinned fish fillets and be able to offer them to her customers.

The “Prosperidad Leal” group is grateful for the loan given as it makes their progress possible. Vanessa is in the back and is the second from the left, wearing a black top. The remaining member Zoila was unable to arrive on time due to work constraints.

loans.use: to buy tinned fish fillets.

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es: Katia de 33 años de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo y su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por que vende su mercadería a precios accesibles. Katia quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Katia, 33, lives with her life companion, her son and her mother in her own house.  She’s been selling clothes for several years and has gained much experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  Her business is home-based.  She’s acquired a large clientele because she sells her merchandise at affordable prices.  

Katia wants to make a new investment but does not have sufficient capital to back her up which is why she’s asking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants and everything else needed for her business.  She’s sure that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time hopes to provide economic security at home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gloria Amalia

texts.es: Doña gloria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, ganchos para el cabello, pulseras, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña gloria solicita un crédito para poder comprar  más mercadería y surtir su negocio pues ese es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  She works selling perfume, hair clips, bracelets, etc. and with profits earned from her sales is able to cover her household expenses.

Gloria’s asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise to stock her business because this is her only source of work and to earn profits to provide better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, hair clips, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es: José de 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa,  El posee una tienda donde vende pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también  jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. José  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda con granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, fruta, aceite, etc. de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar
texts.en: José, 37, lives in his own house with his two sons and his wife. He sells bread, beverages, vegetables, fruit, sweets, soap, shampoo, and other items from a store in his house. José has applied for a loan to stock more merchandise such as grains, juices, sodas, fruit, and oil so that he can better serve his customers and increase sales, which is his priority for taking care of his family.

loans.use: to buy grains, juices, sodas, fruit, oil, etc.

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin’s start-up company, Turtle Box Gifts in Georgetown, Texas, is the perfect way to say thank you or congratulations. Robin creates exquisite gift baskets that contain home-made chocolate chip cookies, muffins, wine, champagne, and anything your heart desires – even cleaning supplies – for  just about anyone in the community. Currently, she works with local real estate agents to send a fun-filled gift basket to recent home buyers once the new residents move in.  

She prides herself on her wonderful baking skills and is excited to soon be able to share these baked goods in gift baskets with the Georgetown and Austin community. She will create any kind of basket for anyone at a reasonable price. 

Robin attended a marketing event in the Austin area where she asked questions about starting a business, and eventually, learned about Accion Texas Inc. She had already used most of her savings and needed cash flow to begin her business. She visited, applied and was approved at Accion in Austin. With the loan, Robin purchased baskets, baking sheets, cookie dough, wine bottles, decorations for the baskets, and small boxes with detailed designs to hold the baked goods. She is also using the loan to develop her website, which will be going live in the next few weeks. Robin realizes that she would not have been able to accomplish all these tasks without the loan from Accion.  

Her plans for the future are to hire an employee, continue advertising by word of mouth, and open a storefront in the Georgetown, Texas area.

loans.use: to purchase baskets, baking sheets, cookie dough, wine bottles, decorations, small boxes and website development.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio has one other full-time employee who assists him in servicing many new and existing residential clients with their home improvement, remodeling and painting needs.  Eleuterio meets the growing demand for his services but was in need of an additional laborer and equipment.  Driving down the road, he saw a sign for Accion Texas Inc. and he knew this was the means to helping him take his business to the next level. 

With the loan, Eleuterio will be able to build his assets by buying new tools such as paintbrushes, rollers, paint, nails, and power tools to complete the repairs and paint jobs his customers rely on him for every day.
