At the same time, Zainab does some embroidery work at home and arranges plastic flowers to be used as home decoration centerpieces. Now Zainab is applying for a loan to buy more fabric so she can make more embroidered pillowcases and buy more material for making plastic flowers.

loans.use: to buy more fabric so she can make more embroidered pillowcases and buy more material for making plastic flowers.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is 29 years old, single, and lives in Sebac, Tudela. She earns a living by selling rice and running a transportation service business. She has been doing this for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from this work. Dinah has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to pay maintenance costs and repairs for her motorcycle. Dinah joined GDMPC last year. Dinah hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay maintenance costs and repairs for her motorcycle

loans.name: Arriane Mae

texts.en: Arraine Mae, a 27-year-old woman from Sebac, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, renders transportation services to the local community for a living. She earns 5,000 PHP monthly from this service business. She offers the unit for rental to her neighbor to have income too. Since joining GDMPC micro credit in the year 2012, she has always been grateful that it helps to uplift their lives. Now, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In the future, she plans to buy another unit of motorcycle to expand her transport services.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Usama

texts.en:
Usama is 33-years-old. He is married and has five children, three of them attend primary school.

Usama has owned a shop for selling mobile phones and computer maintenance since 2011. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a display reception and some maintenance tools for his mobile phone and computer maintenance shop.

Usama hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the displayed goods and improve his income to provide his family with a better life and education.

loans.use: to buy a display reception and some maintenance tools for his mobile phone and computer maintenance shop.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 27-year-old married lady; she has no kids till now. Her husband is currently serving with the military. In the meantime Maryam makes decoration pieces and straw baskets at home for sale.  Although it’s a small business, it helps make an additional income for the family to pay the household bills while her husband is away. 

Now Maryam is applying for a youth loan to purchase some raw material like silicon, straw and others to increase the quantity of items she makes for sale.

loans.use: to acquire some raw materials like silicon, straw and others to increase the quantity of items she makes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old and sells second-hand clothes. She resides in the Dansoman community and joined ID Ghana in 2010.

Mary has been in this business for the past seven years and is doing very well. She is very good and discreet when it comes to her business. 

This is her seventh loan and is for an amount of 1,000 Ghana Cedis (GHS). The loan will help Mary to expand her business and buy brassieres and one bale of second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy brassieres and one bale of second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy roofing materials for his residential house.

loans.name: Matenne

texts.en:
Matenne lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, well-known as the commercial city  of Liberia. She is 43 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 13 and 21. Only one is in school and lives at home. 

For the past two years now Matenne has been running a shop where she sells used clothes. She started this business with the help of her father and learned this way of selling from friends. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Khurram

texts.en:
Khurram is a 34-year-old man. He lives in Pakistan with his wife, three sons and a daughter. 

He owns a cosmetics shop in the market. His income is too low to cover their household expenses. Therefore he is planning to expand his business so that he can increase his net income and savings. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, etc. 

With the profit he will first pay back the loan. Khurram's dream is to provide the best and quality education to his children. He wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 24-year-old married woman who is a mother of one child. She has worked in selling beauty cosmetics and accessories from her house since 2011. Walaa helps her husband with their family's income and puts much effort into developing her business in order to increase her income and provide her family with the necessary standards of living.

Walaa is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase new cosmetics, accessories, and medical earrings. Her business isn't stable in one place; she is mobile among family, friends, relatives, and neighbors, and foreigners.

She is planning to open her own shop in the future to settle down and develop her family's living.

loans.use: To purchase new cosmetics, accessories, and medical earrings

loans.name: Doha

texts.en:
Doha is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of one child. Doha has been selling gifts and accessories for the last eight years. In December 2011, she opened her present shop and improved her family's living a lot. Today, Doha is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua.It will be her second loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good history of repaying her loan. She will use the loan to increase her Brazilian gold and accessories collection. This loan will increase her income in parallel with the increase in business capital collection.

She supports her beloved husband a lot in their family's income and expenses and she's very happy doing so because they are one happy family, as she describes.

She hopes to keep on developing both her social and financial living as much as she can and to provide her child with the best education ever.

loans.use: To buy more Brazilian gold and accessories to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 26 years of age who is married and has two children. Ali is the sole provider for the family.

Ali owns a small shop where he sells electrical equipment like ovens, refrigerators and air-conditioners. He established his business in 2011 and gained experience through previously working at his father's shop. After gaining enough experience, he established his own business and now he has hired his own employee. Ali is growing with fame and respect in his neighborhood.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,100 USD to pay the annual rent of his shop. He aim is to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Tabah

texts.en:
Tabah lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, well-known as the commercial city  of Liberia. Tabah is 46 year old, married with four children between the ages of 20 and 27. 

For the past three years  now, Tabah has been running  a cook shop where she sells rice  and soup. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and  she likes her business because it gives her more money and makes her independent. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients such as peppers, bitter ball (squash), Vita, and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build a house and be an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients such as peppers, bitter ball (squash), Vita, and other items for her business

loans.name: Zaheer

texts.en:
Zaheer is 39 years old. He lives in Pakistan with his wife, two sons and a daughter. He owns a food stall in the market, where he sells tasty and delicious kabab. His income is too low to cover their household expenses. 

Presently, he is in need of purchasing oil, eggs, pulses (lentils) and beef for preparing kabab. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed food items for his stall. 

With the profit he will first pay back the loan. Zaheer's dream is to provide the best and quality education to his children. He wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase oil, eggs, pulses and beef for preparing kabab

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is a 19-year-old married lady. She started a small home business with her husband’s sister selling clothing items to friends and neighbors using both of their connections. Now Gharam is applying for a youth loan to buy more female clothing items in the new summer fashion.

loans.use: to buy more female clothing items to sell

loans.name: Annety

texts.en:
Annety is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children, although only one has begun schooling. This is her only source of income currently and she looks forward to improving the operations within it. She hires workers on a casual basis.

Annety is applying for a loan of 26,250 Kenya shillings to purchase quarry tools and pay the casual laborers. The main challenge is lack of effective transport for the stones from the quarry to the selling site.

loans.use: To purchase quarry tools and pay the casual laborers.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Young farmer Babken lives in Ddmashen village in the region of Sevan. He has a big family consisting of several members: he and his wife, their two sons, his mother and brother. It is a big, genial and consolidated family, always ready to help each other. In their farm they have three cows, five sheep, twenty chickens and two piglets, but the main wealth of their farm are beehives and bee colonies that they have enriched with the help of his previous Kiva loan. The honey that they have is of very high quality and unbelievably good taste. It is the result of hard and honest work during the whole year.

Babken again wants to work with Kiva lenders and is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to expand both his bee colonies and farm animals. He wants to buy a cow and a calf. Babken is sure that his second cooperation with Kiva will be as useful as the first one.

loans.use: To add to his beehives and to buy a cow and calf

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is an 18-year-old single man who has been an employee in a mobile phone sales shop for five years. Hadi was only thirteen years old when he started working in order to help his parents in their living and cover his own expenses.

Hadi is working hard to develop himself and improve his living. That's why he applied for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to invest part of it in doing necessary maintenance for his car and at the same time start a small mobile phone sales business with capital of his own as a first step forward.

Hadi is a man with a very good reputation, well known in his region. He is a hard worker; he is still studying in the morning, where he starts his work in the afternoon. He hopes that one day he can reach a level where he can settle down and enjoy developing his own business in the future.

loans.use: To start his own small business and do necessary maintenance for his car

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es: Gabriel, está casado, tiene la edad de 36 años, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va compra las telas para la elaboración de sus nuevos uniformes. El tiene conformado desde ya varios años su mariachi por lo cual cree conveniente el cambio de vestimenta para ser mas innovadores al igual que tener más clientela y a la vez generar una muy buena impresión a la hora de presentarse a sus labores. El con el mariachi tiene un ingreso extra para su familia y además le brinda otros ingresos a otras personas por tocar con el en las presentaciones, por lo cual espera aumentar contrataciones para este siguiente temporada y salir adelante con sus proyectos y brindarle un ingreso extra a sus compañeros y al igual que el tener un futuro más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gabriel is 36 years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and 3 children, who are his first priority.  With this loan, he is going to buy fabric for making new uniforms for his mariachi band.  He has been a part of the mariachi band for several years, and for this reason he believes it is time to change their uniform to be more innovative so that they can gain more clients.  He wants to make a good impression at his shows.  Working in the mariachi band brings in extra income for his family and also offers income to other band members who perform at the shows.  Gabriel hopes to increase hiring for this next season and to move forward with the band's projects to provide extra income to his companions and secure a more stable economic future.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any prior loans in state banks, but FUNDECOSUR has given him a loan with a better payment plan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy uniforms for his mariachi band

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio; este le permitirá comprar una cámara y papel fotográfico para una mejor calidad en las fotos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su equipo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: José has presented the need to continue investing in his business; this loan will allow him to purchase a camera and photography paper to improve the quality of his photos.  The previous loan helped him to increase his income and improve his equipment.  His financial condition and family circumstances have been greatly improved.

loans.use: to purchase a camera and photography paper for better quality in his photos.

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of five partners: Gladys, Sabaina, Augustina, Lydia and Jonathan who all reside in Dansoman. They have been a group since 2009 and are doing very well. They sell bread, phones, fried plantain, jeans and provisions, respectively. 

Gladys is a 54-year-old bread seller. She is a widow. This has been her work for the past 10 years and is doing very well. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. She has been with ID Ghana for the past four years and still loves to be part of the organization. She has taken seven loans and has fully repaid all of them. For her eighth loan, she is requesting GHS 1,000 to help her buy enough flour, sugar, and margarine to bake bread to sell to customers. 

The entire group needs a loan of GHS 4,400 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around the community.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread to sell

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Keneth from Bulawayo. He is married with one child, who attends school. Keneth runs a retail business buying men's jeans, trousers, shoes, and jackets for resale. He also buys electrical gadgets for resale, like adaptors and cellphone accessories, and women's clothing too. The business has been in operation for 8 years. He says the main challenges faced are lack of working capital, and exorbitant duty charges when declaring goods at the border. Keneth has requested a loan of $300 to order more stock and restock new products for winter. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to have more disposable income, which will enable him to pay for rentals and other day-to-day expenses. In the future Keneth plans to own a clothing and electrical shop in the Central Business District.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing from outside the country (where it is cheaper), electrical gadgets, and women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en: Zafar is a 43-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. Since 2005, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. Zafar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, he can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Zafar's husband is a very hard-working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 36 years old and comes from Ramallah. She is married and has two children who attend primary school. She has owned a beauty salon since 2003.

Manal asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a laser machine for skin facial cleansing for her salon. This loan will help her increase her clients and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a laser machine for skin facial cleansing for her salon.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que desde muy temprana edad se dedica  a la ganadería y a la agricultura, pero en sus horas libres trabaja en el área de obra en una entidad pública. Desde hace varios años  pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.

Julian nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julian is 36 years old and is married.  The fruit of his beautiful marriage is six children.  Julian is a hardworking person that from an early age has been dedicated to working with livestock and agriculture.  In his free time, he also works at a public agency.  For several years he has been a member of the communal bank "El Balcon," and this time he needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Julian was born in the district of Challabamba, but now he lives in the community of Majopato, a settlement in Carnicero.  The community of Majopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, within the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Willian Napoleón

texts.es:
Willian tiene 25 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad; fue su padre quien le enseño. También, trabaja cuidando unos animales y bueyes. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a ordeñar una vaca y ha enyugar sus bueyes, se toma una tasa de café y luego se dirige al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos y tarda una hora en llegar. Ahí trabaja durante 8 horas, se regresa a su casa a alimentar sus bueyes. Manifiesta estar muy agradecido con su padre porque le enseño  a trabajar. Él camina aproximadamente 10 minutos de su casa hasta el lugar en donde aborda un camión que hace su recorrido de una hora a hora y media. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de fertilizantes, una bolsa de semilla, dos galones de herbicidas, dos litros de pesticidas y para pago de mano de obra para sembrar maíz.  Él ya tiene el terreno para cultivar, pero no el dinero para comprar los insumos y el invierno ya comenzó y necesita el dinero para empezar a sembrar y que su cosecha sea abundante, ya que es a lo único que se dedica y de ahí obtiene el alimento para su familia. Espera recibir ingresos para ahorrar y construir su propia casa, debido a que esta viviendo con sus padres.
texts.en:
Willian is 25 years old, married and has a son.  He has been a farmer since he was ten years old and learned this from his father.  He also works with some animals and oxen.  He gets up at 4:00 am and milks a cow and yoke up the oxen.  He has a cup of coffee and then goes to the fields where he has his crops.  It takes him an hour to get there.  There he works for eight hours and returns home to feed his oxen.  He says that he is very grateful to his father because he taught him how to work.  He walks about 10 minutes from his house to where he takes the bus to make his one and a half hour trip.

He is asking for this loan through Fundación Campo, so he can buy eight sacks of fertilizer, a bag of seeds, two gallons of herbicide, two liters of pesticides, and pay for labor to plant corn.  He already has farmland but not the money to buy supplies and the winter has already started and he needs money with which to plant so that he will have an abundant harvest.  This is the only thing he does to feed his family.  He hopes to have income to save up and build a house of his own because he is living with his parents.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marther K.

texts.en: Marther  lives in Sinkor, in Montserrado County, where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known in Liberia. Marther is 44 years old and married. She has six children between the ages of seven and 30 years old. Two of her children are in school and live at home. For the past five years, Marther has been selling peppers, eggplant and bitter ball in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours on her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table, She said, "I am business minded, and like my business because it gives me more profit." Marther is requesting a loan to buy more peppers, eggplant and bitter ball to expand her sales. She wants to earn more money so she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy more peppers, eggplant and bitter ball to expand her sales,

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 40-year-old hard-working man. He lives with his wife and four sons in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2005, Saleem has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, he can buy a variety of goods for his general store, including biscuits, chips, juices and sweets to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for a better future for his children.

Saleem is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for his family and business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, such as biscuits, chips, juices and sweets, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To order a mixture of soft drinks for resale at their shop

loans.name: Nuch

texts.en:
Nuch lives in Sinkor, Montserrado County, Liberia.  Nuch is a 24-year-old, single woman with two children, ages 3 and 7 years old.  Both are in school and live at home.  For the past five years she has been selling body-spray, body-cream, fashion-slippers, and others items.  Nuch started this business with the help of her father and learned this way of selling from him.  She likes her business because it gives her more profit and makes her popular.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more body-spray, body-cream, fashion-slippers, and additional goods for her business.  She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase body-spray, body-cream, fashion-slippers, and additional goods for her business.

loans.name: Floice

texts.en:
Floice is a 30-year-old married lady with three children, ages 2, 5, and 9 years old.  She sells secondhand clothing and has been running the business for five years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.  She learned about KADET LTD from a neighbor.

She has borrowed her fifth loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD.  With this loan she intends to purchase more clothing for the business.  The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.  Her dreams are to improve her living standards and to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to buy more stock of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.es: Anthony  de 22  años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de Ingeniería De Sistemas   que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Anthony  tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero de sistemas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Anthony    se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Anthony is 22 years old, single and without children.  He is a pleasant student in the department of Systems Engineering. He studies a lot in order to achieve his goals in life.  Anthony hopes graduate from his studies with honors and to be a good systems engineer.  With this loan Anthony will pay his room and board at the university and will purchase the supplies that he needs to study.  Anthony is very grateful for the help and looks forward to finally completing his goals thanks to the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his room and board at university

loans.name: Elsa Edith

texts.es:
Elsa, solicita un nuevo préstamo por otro crédito para seguir trabajando con su negocio de venta de tortillas; este le permitirá comprar 10 quintales de maíz y tener materia prima reservada.
El crédito anterior le ha ayudado a incrementar la clientela y satisfacer las necesidades de ellos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Elsa is applying for a new loan to continue working in her business of selling tortillas. This will allow her to buy 10 quintales (about 1000 lb)  of corn and have a reserve of basic ingredients.

The previous loan has helped her to increase her clientele and satisfy their needs. Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintales of corn and have a reserve of basic ingredients

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 29 years old from Gaza.  He is married and has one child.  He owns a grocery store since 2010.  Mohammad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and to install shelves in the grocery store.  He hopes that this loan will help him to increase the goods displayed and thus improve his income.  This will enable him to provide his child with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and install shelves in the grocery store.

loans.name: Patricio Solis Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Marisol mujer de 26 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos menores su negocio es la venta de flores artificiales, chischiles de palma, productos de limpieza de ropa como detergentes, jabón, cloro, hace etc. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 10 años, ella misma vende en el mercado de Granada. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para hacer adornos florales como plásticos, alambres, mechas, materia prima para hacer chischil como palma, tapas, madera etc., comercializa también cosa de horno, jabón, hace, cloro etc. Miriam tiene 45 años de edad y su negocio es fábrica de trensas de manila para sandalias y José hombre de 45 años de edad su negocio es artesanía en palma.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Marisol, a 26 year old woman, who is in a long term relationship, and has two young children.  Her business is selling artificial flowers, chischiles (Nicaraguan rattles) made of palm, and cleaning products such as detergent, bleach, soap, etc.  She began this business 10 years ago and she makes her sales in the Granada market.  She will invest this loan in the purchase basic materials for floral arrangements like plastic, wires, and wax as well as basic materials to make chischil (traditional Nicaraguan rattle) such as palms, covers, wood, etc.  She also sells baking products, soap, bleach, etc.  

Miriam is 45 years old and her business is making braided and beaded sandal straps.  José is a 45 year old man whose business is producing handicrafts from palms.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials for floral arrangements like plastic, wires, and wax as well as basic materials to make chischil (traditional Nicaraguan rattle) such as palms, covers, wood, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel de 60 años de edad, es una de aquellas personas digna de admiración y respeto, las cuales enseñan que en la vida la actitud y el deseo de progreso es lo más importante. A pesar de encontrarse en condición de discapacidad, tras perder su mano derecha, este hombre siguió luchando por lo más importante para él; su familia. Desde hace 25 años labora como vendedor ambulante con el fin de ganarse el sustento para él y su familia. Diariamente sale a las calles con su carreta en donde comercializa mangos y aguacates. De esta manera Miguel ha logrado brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida a su familia. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una sombrilla (para la carreta) y surtido  con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y no perjudicarse con las constantes lluvias.
texts.en: Miguel is 60 years old and is one of those people who is worthy of admiration and respect, who teach that your attitude and desire to progress is the most important thing in life.  Despite being disabled after losing his right hand, this man continues to fight for those most important to him: his family.  For 25 years he has worked as a traveling salesman in order to make a living for himself and his family.  Every day he goes out to the streets with his cart, where he sells mangos and avocados.  In this way, Miguel has managed to provide a better life for his family.  Today he is asking for this loan so that he can invest in an umbrella (for his cart) and an assortment of fruits in order to increase his level of sales and not have his business harmed by the constant rains.

loans.use: to buy an umbrella (for the cart) and an assortment of fruits (mango and avocado)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of hardware

loans.name: M.l. Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por  tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Patricia socia, mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos mayores de edad, tiene cinco años de tener su negocio de taller de zapatería, además vende sandalias los comercializa en los municipios de Diria, Diriomo y en la comunidad de palo quemado, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias bajas, sandalias de plataformas, zapato de hombre, zapato colegial etc. Marta tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno y venta de nacatamales y Martha Lorena tiene 28 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurial members. One of the members is Patricia, a woman of 43. She is married and has two adult children. She has had her business, a shoe workshop, for five years. In addition, she sells sandals. She sells them in the towns of Diria and Diriomo and in the Palo Quemado region. She will invest the loan in the purchase of low sandals, platform sandals, men's shoes, school shoes, etc. 

Marta is 54 years old, and her business is selling "cosas de horno" [baked corn products] and nacatamales [a typical Nicaraguan dish]. Martha Lorena is 28, and her business is selling Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy low sandals, platform sandals, men's shoes, school shoes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Burulsun

texts.ru:
Бурулсун 50 лет, имеет 3 детей. Бурулсун в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается торговлей товарами народного спроса, стартовав в 1996 году с  суммы 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулсун, она смогла купить дом для своей семьи, на сегодняшний день  ее прибыль составляет (KGS)20 000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулсун  обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение товарооборота посредством закупа партии мыломоющих средств.  Доходы от кредита Бурулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а в этом году построить забор.
texts.en: Burulsun is 50 years old and has three children. She is supporting her family by selling household goods at the local market. She started her business in 1996 with 15000 som. Due to her diligence Burulsun was able to buy a house for her family and now her business makes 20,000 som (KGS) in profits. In order to further develop her business Burulsun has turned to the micro-finance bank "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to increase goods turnover in her store by purchasing a large batch of detergents. She is planning to use the profits from this loan to continue growing her business, and also build a fence around her house this year.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of detergents

loans.name: Tumara

texts.ru:
Тумаре 32 года, имеет 3 детей. Тумара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2003 году с  покупки коровы и овец на сумму 18,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Тумары, на сегодняшний день она имеет 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади, ее прибыль составляет (KGS) 12,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тумара  обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку еще одной дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Тумара  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность обучить детей.
texts.en: Tumara is 32 years old and has three children. In order to support her family she raises cattle. She started her farm in 2003 by buying a cow and some sheep with 18,000 som. Due to her diligence Tumara now has four milk cows, ten sheep and two horses and makes 12,000 som (KGS) monthly profits. In order to further develop her business Tumara has turned to micro-finance bank "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to purchase another milk cow. Tumara plans to invest the profits from this loan back into her business so that in the future she will be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow
